loans.name: Prosperidad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Prosperidad está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura, Cuenca es cuna de deportistas y escritores, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, se dedica al comercio, crianza de animales, a la agricultura y muchas personas ejercen diferentes trabajos en la ciudad.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, es socia del grupo de crédito Prosperidad desde hace 12 años, en todo este tiempo ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras y a su vez con los créditos ha ido mejorando poco a poco la situación de su familia.

La Señora. Ana tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven independientes. Su esposo le ayuda en casa ya que es jubilado, la casa en la que viven es propia. 

Doña Ana se dedica a la costura desde hace hace 30 años, elabora ropa deportiva y lencería, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo, este oficio lo aprendió de su suegra quien le heredo este trabajo. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas e hilos.

Su meta es comprar más maquinas para agrandar su taller.
texts.en:
The Prosperidad communal bank is made up of eight female members and one male member who live in the city of Cuenca, a city known for the beauty of its architecture. Cuenca is the birthplace of athletes and writers, and its people uphold their culture and traditions making their livelihood in sales, rearing animals and agriculture and many people carry out different types of work in the city.

One of the members of this group is Ana, she has been a member of the Prosperidad communal bank for 12 years and during all of this time she has cultivated wonderful friendships with all of her colleagues as well as seeing her family's situation improve with the loans.

Ana is 62 years old, she is married and the fruit of her marriage is four adult children who are married and live on their own. Her husband helps her at home as he is retired, and the home in which they live is their own.

Ana has been making her living as a seamstress for the last 30 years, she makes sports clothes and linen, she works from Monday to Friday without a fixed work schedule. She learnt this trade from her mother-in-law who passed on this work.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of threads and fabrics. Her aim is to buy more machines to expand her workshop.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: 12-01-06 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh has a retail business, selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

Oanh is 33 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 12-01-06 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. Oanh supports two dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Oanh's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Oanh hopes for her children to do well in school, to travel within the country for vacation, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana, con 30 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos de 13, 12, 9 y 7 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Por falta de oportunidades laborales y debido a la difícil situación económica por la que han atravesado, ella decidió iniciar la venta de mercancía por catálogo y a elaborar accesorios de bisutería, con el fin de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar; estas actividades las aprendió de manera empírica, por medio de la observación. Diana es una mujer trabajadora, juiciosa, activa, dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Ellos son la principal motivación para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de insumos (piedras, rollos de cadena, broches, cintas) y mercancía al por mayor (cremas corporales, cosméticos, productos de aseo personal), con esto podrá darle continuidad a ambos negocios, pues tendrá insumos disponibles para elaborar los accesorios y poder venderlos, además tendrá un inventario de mercancía diverso para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de cada uno; esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende, sus ingresos.  
Diana sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, por lo cual trabaja incansablemente para que sus productos tengan un factor diferenciador, que la haga relucir por encima de sus competidores y hacer de sus actividades una fuente de ingresos perdurable en el tiempo, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y continuar educando a sus hijos de la mejor manera, para que tengan un futuro exitoso.
texts.en: Diana, 30, has 4 children who are aged 13, 12, 9 and 7 and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. In order to support her partner in contributing to the household income, she decided to initiate a catalog sales business and make jewelry because of the lack of job opportunities and difficult economic times; she learned these activities empirically, by way of observation. Diana is a hard-working, judicious, active woman dedicated to her family and her work. They are the reason she is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of supplies (stones, chains, brooches, ribbons) and wholesale merchandise (body lotions, cosmetics, personal hygiene products). With this, she will be able to continue both businesses as she'll have supplies available to make and sell accessories and she'll also have a diverse inventory of merchandise to offer her clients to satisfy the tastes and needs of each one. This will be reflected in her sales, and thus, her income. Diana dreams of growing her business, and so she works incessantly to provide products that have a distinguishing factor; that make her shine above her competitors; and that will provide a long-lasting fountain of income. That way, she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life and continue educating her children in the best way, so they'll be successful in the future.

loans.use: buy supplies (stones, chains, brooches, ribbons) and wholesale merchandise (body lotions, cosmetics, personal hygiene products).

loans.name: 12-01-05 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for resale.

Ngân is 38 years old and she is married with two children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 12-01-05 Quảng Tâm solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ngân's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Ngân has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Victoire Josette

texts.fr:
Victoire Josette vit au Bénin et est âgée de 52 ans. 
Elle est mariée avec Aziz qui est enseignant.

Depuis près de 30 ans, elle achète des fourneaux en argile et des canaris (récipient rond en terre cuite) dans un village reconnu pour cette production afin de les revendre dans son quartier.
Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de pouvoir développer son activité et utiliser les bénéfices pour acheter une parcelle.
texts.en: Victoire Josette lives in Benin and is 52 years  old. She is married to Aziz, a teacher. For almost 30 years, she has been buying clay ovens and “canaris” (terra cotta vessels) in a village known for the production of these goods, and then reselling them in her neighborhood. She is applying for this loan in order to be able to grow her business and use her revenues to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy clay pots for resale.

loans.name: 12-01-03 Quảng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trâm works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

Trâm is 61 years old and she is married with one child. Trâm is the group leader of the 12-01-03 Quảng Tâm solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents as her child is grown up.

This is Trâm first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Trâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Trâm hopes to build a new house. She hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

loans.name: Urangoo

texts.en:
Mrs. Urangoo, 25 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She graduated from physical training college as a teacher in 2009. She has been working as a teacher in physical training at a high school since 2010. Her husband is a sales manager at a private business entity. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam. The couple currently lives in a one-room apartment which loses its heat and becomes cold during wintertime. After insulation, she and her husband can live in a comfortable and warm place.

loans.use: to insulate her one-room apartment

loans.name: 11.01.02 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Ms. Tý operates a food stall selling pork skins; she is requesting a loan to purchase pork skins to resell for her food stall.

Tý is 58 years old, she is single with no children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 11.01.02 Trường Thi solidarity group. The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living. 

Tý lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Tý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tý has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Tý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tý and her family hope to travel for a vacation within the country. She hopes for their family to be healthy and happy, and for their business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork skins to resell for her food stall

loans.name: Sopheap Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 32 and a mother of three children, is a hard-working farmer who strives for a living via rice growing on one hectare area. Her husband also helps her to earn more income through taxi-driving. Her current business which she has had for ages has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. Sopheap is not a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her living as well as her business at a good pace and keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, she has formed a group of three to get a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) again.  She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each while the remaining member is applying for 600,000 KHR. Sopheap is the leader, and she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and rice seed for her farmland, and use a portion of it to fix her husband’s taxi. She hopes this loan will help her business in a timely manner and she will get a good yield with high profit.

loans.use: To buy potash and rice seed for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Julieth Patricia

texts.es: Julieth tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, actividad que aprendió de sus familiares y que alterna con su profesión de ingeniera agrónoma. De esta forma ha obtenido ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer pujante, inteligente, emprendedora y activa. Siempre va buscando opciones que le ayuden a cumplir el sueño de tener su propio almacén de artesanías. Esto la motiva para solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de materiales e insumos (madera, pinturas, flores artificiales), así podrá darle continuidad a su negocio y seguirá generando ingresos para la manutención de su hogar, además podrá ahorrar para adquirir un local propio a mediano plazo y así poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Julieth is 29 years old, single, and has no children yet. She has been making handicrafts for three years, an activity she learned from her family members and which she alternates with her profession as an agricultural engineer. In this way she has obtained income for meeting the basic needs of her household. 

She is a strong, intelligent, enterprising and energetic woman. She is always looking for opportunities that will help her fulfill her dream of having her own handicraft store. This is the reason for requesting the loan, with the aim of investing in the purchase of materials and supplies such as wood, paint and artificial flowers. 

This way she will be able to keep her business going and continue generating income for maintaining her household. In addition, she will be able to save, in order to acquire her own shop in the medium-term, and be able to enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies such as wood, paint and artificial flowers.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria forma parte del grupo de crédito Soledad del Valle, este tipo de crédito le gusta primero que le ayudan en su negocio y también porque en cada reunión establecen una mejor amistad con todas sus amigas. Vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha belleza natural y existen verdes campos donde se disfruta de una gran  tranquilidad saliéndonos de la rutina de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y el comercio.

La Señora Gloria tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 4 años. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en donde trabaja.

Doña Gloria labora como empleada domestica, se encuentra en este trabajo desde muy joven, pero para tener un ingreso extra se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes y gallinas, también se dedica a la agricultura y su cosecha la vende.

Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar en esta actividad. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gloria is part of the Soledad del Valle communal bank. She likes this type of loan primarily because it helps her with her business also because at each meeting, she forges a stronger friendship with all of her friends. She lives in the Del Valle parish of Cuenca, a place which is graced with a lot of natural beauty and there are green fields where there is a great feeling of tranquility taking us away from the routing of the city. Its people make its living rearing animals, in agriculture and sales.

Gloria is 24 years old, she is a single mother to a 4-year-old daughter. She doesn't have her own home which is why she lives where she works.

Gloria works as a domestic employee, and has been in this job from a very young age, but to have an additional income she rears pigs, guinea pigs and chicken. She also works as a farmer and sells her produce.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of poultry to start this activity. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Rafaela De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Señora. Rafaela es socia desde hace 5 años del grupo de crédito Soledad del Valle, le gusta este grupo porque  todas las socias son muy unidas que se apoyan en cualquier circunstancia de la vida. Vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha belleza natural y existen verdes campos donde se disfruta de una gran  tranquilidad saliéndonos de la rutina de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y el comercio.

La Señora Rafaela tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijas  mayores de edad que son casadas y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Rafaela desde hace 15 años trabaja como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y credos. 

Su nuevo crédito va ser invertido en la compra de cuyes, pollos y cerdos.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia y más animales.
texts.en:
Rafaela has been a member of the Soledad del Valle communal bank for five years, she likes the group as all the members are very united and they support each other at any moment in life. She lives nearby the Del Valle parish in Cuenca, a place which is blessed with a lot of natural beauty and there are green fields where a great feeling of tranquility can be enjoyed, exporting us from the daily routine of the city. Cuenca's people make their living rearing animals, in farming and sales.

Rafaela is 58 years old, she is a single mother to two adult children who are married and live on their own. She doesn't have her own home which is why she is living in a rented property. 

For the last 15 years, Rafaela has been working as a domestic employee, she works from Monday to Friday for the whole day. At home, she rears chicken, guinea pigs and pigs.

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs, chicken and pigs. Her dream is to have her own home and more animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicken and pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is very thankful for the loan that she borrowed. It helped her in many ways, not just in business but even in their household. She also has a 'tricycle' for additional income. Her husband is helping her in managing their business. 

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their van and 'tricycle'. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia dreams of having additional vehicle and hopes to have a happy life with her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van and 'tricycle'.

loans.name: Vet's Group

texts.en:
Vet is a widowed mother of three children. The rest of her family is living in Kampong Cham province where she does her agricultural business. Her one hectare of rice farming, which she has been with for 25 years, has returned her about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Vet is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is leading a group of five to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Vet will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her business. She hopes to plant her rice seasonably and make a good yield so as she can generate more income and buy additional plots of farmland to expand her crop farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: 11.01.06 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yên has a manufacturing business sewing clothes; she is requesting a loan to purchase cloth to make clothes.

Yên is 42 years old, she is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 11.01.06 Trường Thi solidarity group. The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living. 

Yên supports two dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Yên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yên has been involved in this business for about 10 years. The main hardship that Yên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Yên and her family hope their children will do well in school. They hope for their family to be healthy and happy, and for their business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda, 36 years of age, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with six children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 18 years, and with this business she's earning an income of Php 300 daily. Due to lack of capital she would like to access a loan amounting to Php 12,000 to purchase beverages, cooking oil, sugar, bread, and coffee. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will able to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, cooking oil, sugar, bread, and coffee

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more 'piaya'. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more' piaya', a flat unleavened bread filled with muscovado sugar. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melinda hopes to have more customers and that her family won't get sick. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more 'piaya' (unleavened bread) to sell.

loans.name: 3.17.311.6.thiệu Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lợi works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Lợi faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Lợi is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Lợi is the group leader of the 3.17.311.6.Thiệu Tâm solidarity group, which consists of six members. This is Lợi’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lợi hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies and raw materials (stone, thread, paint and beads).

loans.name: Sourrou Donatien

texts.fr:
Sourrou Donatien a 45 ans, réside au Bénin et est marié avec Blanche, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont eu 5 enfants, dont certains sont en âge d'être scolarisés, et ont un enfant qui leur a été confié.

Depuis 25 ans, Donatien exerce avec un grand professionnalisme le métier d'électricien dans son atelier et est connu de sa clientèle pour sa courtoisie.
Aujourd'hui il demande un prêt avec de renforcer et développer son activité. Régulièrement il se rend au Nigeria pour acheter des pièces électroniques afin de réparer les équipements électroniques que ses clients lui apportent. De plus, il souhaite dorénavant acheter aussi des DVDs et des postes de télévision pour pouvoir les vendre.

Avec les bénéfices, il continuera à subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sourrou Donatien is 45 and lives in Bénin. He is married to Blanche, a merchant. Together they have five children, some of whom are old enough to attend school. They also have one child who was entrusted to them. 

For 25 years, Donatien has worked with great professionalism as an electrician in his workshop and he is known to his clientele for his courteous behavior. 

Today he is requesting a loan to strengthen and expand his activity. He goes regularly to Nigeria to buy electronics parts so as to repair electronics equipment that his clients bring to him. Besides that, he would like from now on to buy DVDs and television sets to resell. 

With the profit he will continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy electronic equipment for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen's eleventh loan cycle. She used her loans on her business, and this gave her a good reward. Her business is continuously expanding, and she now has two tricycles. Her children are all working now, and she uses her income in their everyday expenses. Her husband helps her in generating income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycles. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmen dreams to have more tricycles. She meets up with her *co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycles.

loans.name: Vital Yovany

texts.es:
Vital, es una persona de hogar, vive con su compañera de vida y disfruta de tres hijos. El se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, asimismo posee una tienda; dicha actividad la aprendió con unos amigos y luego decidió comprar un vehículo para salir a vender  la mercadería a sus clientes en la calle y en el mercado, la venta de frutas y verduras lo desempeña desde hace 1 año, mientras que la tienda desde hace 6 años.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la mercadería necesaria, tales como: frutas, verduras, golosinas, bebidas, granos básicos, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la adquisición y surtir mas la tienda, también le generara más ingresos.
Sus sueños es ampliar sus ventas y su tienda, agregar otro tipo de productos, mejorar su vivienda; ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Vital is a homebody who lives with his wife and has three children.  He sells fruits and vegetables and also has a store.  He learned to do this from friends and then decided to buy a car so he could sell to his customers in the street and in the market.  He’s been selling fruits and vegetables for a year and has had the store for six.

This loan will allow him to buy the merchandise he needs, such as fruits, vegetables, snacks, drinks, basic grains, and other things.  This investment will help him improve his acquisition and stock his store better.  It will also generate an income.

His dreams are to increase his sales, add other products to his store, make improvements to his home, offer a better quality of life to his family, and grow as a small businessman.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Toto

texts.en: Toto appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva. It enabled her to earn profits to improve her grocery business, which helped her to improve her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase vegetables and onions and to start poultry farming. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and onions and to start poultry farming

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na, 33, lives with her husband and one child in Cambodia in a village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for almost five years, and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee.

Na has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for five loan cycles and has paid back her loans completely. She has managed to improve her livelihood with the loans and can now earn about 23,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day from her current business. She is now leading her group to ask for another loan and will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice and cassava plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so they can earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice and cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Blanca Sara

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca forma parte del grupo de crédito Soledad del Valle, su grupo de crédito le gusta por el compañerismo y la solidaridad y porque los créditos le benefician para mejorar su negocio. Vive por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha belleza natural y existen verdes campos donde se disfruta de una gran  tranquilidad saliéndonos de la rutina de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y el comercio.

La Señora. Blanca tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora como estibador, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada.

Doña Blanca se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a continuar con el trabajo que aprendió de sus padres el cual es la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. También se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y trabaja todos los días en el cuidado de una granja. 

Su nuevo crédito va a  invertir en la compra de cerdos y  alimento para animales.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank "Soledad del Valle" which she likes because of the solidarity and companionship of the group and because the loans help her improve her business.  She lives in the Valle Parish in Cuenca, which is a place with much natural beauty and green pastures where one can relax and get away from busy city life.  Local people here are involved in livestock farming, agriculture and commerce.

Blanca, 30, is married and has three children, ages 13, 11, and 9.  Her eldest daughter is in middle school and the two younger children attend the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a stevedor and they live in a house that is on loan to them.

Blanca is a homemaker and also works in agriculture which she learned from her parents.  The produce she grows is for home consumption and any surplus is for selling.  She also raises pigs and works every day on the farm.

Her new loan will be used to buy pigs and animal feed.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To  buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates the previous loan that helped her earn profits and thus improved her standard of living. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase cereals such as rice, beans, maize, and millet for her business. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cereals such as rice, beans, maize, and millet for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras se llama este grupo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 14 de las integrantes están con ingresos muy bajos, y luchando pese a ello por ir mejorando cada día.
Una de las integrantes es Rigoberta, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida, y donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella es una persona con grandes esperanzas y sueños, y lucha por su familia. Su meta es poder seguir agrandando su despensa e ir ampliando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, carnes, leche y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes todo lo que piden. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Mujeres Trabajadores.  They are taking part in the poverty elimination survey, where 14 of the members have very low incomes.  In spite of that, they are struggling every day to improve.

Rigoberta is one of the members.  She has a well-stocked grocery store where she works, starting in the very early hours, every day.  She is a person with big hopes and dreams, and she struggles for her family.  Her goal is to be able to continue making her grocery store bigger and expanding.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, milk, and other supplies so that she can continue offering her customers everything they ask for.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she is getting.  It will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, milk, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La Sra.  Dora es comerciante, tiene una despensa hace varios años con clientela formada, es una persona muy trabajadora y comenta que empezó con una modesta despensa, pero que después con su sacrificio ha ido mejorando.
Aparte de esta actividad su marido se dedica a la fabricación de pelotas hace varios años y por medio de ese trabajo están dando a su familia para el día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser: arroz, harina, fideo, azúcar, etc. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo de ir mejorando.
texts.en:
Dora is a merchant who has been running a store for several years with a fixed clientele.  She is a very hard worker who claims she began with a small business and was able to improve it through much effort.

Apart from this activity, her husband has been in the ball making business for several years earning enough for the daily family expenses.

Dora is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store such as rice, flour, noodles, sugar, etc.  She is grateful for this opportunity to be able to improve her situation.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola es de la ciudad de Pilar, quien está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial. Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y que está luchando por ser alguien en la vida e ir mejorando su vida.
Ella se destaca por el gran esfuerzo que hace en sus estudios, ya que trata de poder sobresalir e ir mejorando cada día. Ella es una persona muy entusiasta.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y de esa forma estar cada vez mas cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Paola is from the city of Pilar. She is studying for a degree in Industrial Engineering. Paola is a hardworking woman who is determined to be someone in life and is willing to make improvements in her life.

She is known for putting forth great effort into her studies. Paola tries to excel and improve each day since she is a very enthusiastic person. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the payment of her fees. This will help get one step closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado María Auxiliadora está empezando su ciclo uno del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren esforzarse por sus hijos, ya que quieren darle todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Mirian hace comestibles de todo tipo, y es muy hábil en las ventas y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien. Es muy luchadora y trabajadora, y desea ir mejorando cada día, y también poder ir mejorando sus ingresos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos y demás, y asi seguir trabajando y luchando
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Auxiliadora" is beginning a loan cycle in the women entrepreneurs's program.  The women are heads of family who want to do all they can for their children so they will have everything they, themselves, were unable to have.

Mirian makes all kind of food and is very good at sales, so she is running a profitable business. She is a very hard worker and wants to continue improving day by day to increase her income.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to continue her food business, such as vegetables, meat, seasonings and other items.  This is so she can continue working and struggling to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, seasonings and other items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, who is 58 years of age, is married and blessed with three children.

She has managed a hog raising business for almost 10 years. In this business she earns a net income of 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per piglet. Due to lack of funding, she decided to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more income in her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 27 years old, single, and recently residing in the village of Union, where she operates a food production business. Michelle has been making and selling chicharon (fried crispy pork) for almost 2 years. Due to insufficient funds, she wanted to avail herself of a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy ingredients for her food business. She uses the income she makes from her sales to pay monthly house rental costs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide for the needs of her parents and her future family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres unidas al Progreso  está en su ciclo 22. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las 16 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero ellas están trabajando por mejorar su situación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Esther, quien cuenta que vende cosméticos, ella por medio de su esfuerzo y de su trabajo esta saliendo adelante. Es una persona trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere ir mejorando su economía, y por medio de ello seguir sustentando a su familia. Ella es muy optimista y con muchas ganas de crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de distintas marcas, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y poder ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres unidas al Progreso" is in its 22nd loan cycle.  The members have taken the poverty elimination survey which shows that three of the 16 members are below the poverty line, with a very low income.  But they are working to improve their situation.

One of the members of the group is Esther who sells cosmetics.  Through her efforts and hard work she is able to get ahead.  She is  a hard-working, dedicated person who wants to improve her economy and continue supporting her family.  She is very optimistic and determined to grow.

She is requesting a loan to buy different brands of cosmetics so she can continue with her sales and offer a wide variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Myrian

texts.es:
La señora Myrian tiene 46 años, es casada no tiene hijo, ella se dedica al comercio, ya que tiene una despensa y comedor, en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Se inició teniendo un copetín, y después abrió a lado una despensa, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad que tiene.
Solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, carnes y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma tener los ingresos para invertir en la casa.
texts.en:
Myrian, 46, is married and has no children.  She is a merchant who runs a grocery store and diner in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  

She started out with a snack bar and then opened a grocery store which is going very well.  She has a very loyal, long-term customer base.

She is requesting a loan to buy goods for the store such as drinks, groceries, meats and other supplies to continue with her sales.  Her aim is to have enough income to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy drinks, groceries, meat and other suppliers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 37 years old and married. She lives with her family in the village of Dalakip. To help her husband raise her children, Elizabeth engages in a direct sales business in which she sells lipstick, cologne, lotion, deodorant, and make-up kits. Right now, she wants to have more products to offer and sell in her village, but she lacks some capital. Thus she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy lotion, colognes, lipsticks, and perfume to sell. She hopes to grow her business, and she hopes to have her own stall someday.

loans.use: to buy lotion, colognes, lipsticks and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is grateful for the previous loan that enabled her to stock her food stall, thus attracting more customers and generating more profits. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase tomatoes, onions, and vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to obtain financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Behzod

texts.ru: Бехзод очень добрый и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он живет со своими родителями. Бехзод 22 года. В семье были разногласие и вздоры. Из - за этого мать часто болела. Он мечтал стать врачом и лечить свою любимую мать. Отец старался, чтобы его сыновья получили хорошее образования. Несмотря на тяжелые дни, он окончил среднюю школу с отличными оценками. Вот он поступил в Медицинский Университет. Сбылась его мечта, но для учёбы надо платить. Дома нет сбережений.  Отец уехал в Россию на заработки, и там проработал 3 года. На заработную плату  невозможно содержать семью и оплатить учёбу Бехзода. Бехзод запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Behzod is a very kind and hard-working young man. He is 22 and lives with his parents. Because of disagreements in the family, his mother was often ill. He dreamed of becoming a doctor and curing his beloved mother. His father tried to keep his sons from receiving a good education. In spite of the hard times, Behzod graduated from high school with excellent grades and entered medical school. His dream came true, but he needs to pay for his studies and has no savings at home. His father has worked in Russia for three years and sends home money, but he cannot support the family and also pay for Behzod's education. Behzod has requested a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition at the university.

loans.name: Cochapamba  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cochapamba está formado por 7 mujeres muy trabajadoras quienes viven por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeada de mucha vegetación, de verdes campos y grandes paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, la arquitectura de esta parroquia se mezcla entre lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente al igual que todas las socias son personas amables, gentiles que día a día buscan mejorar su estabilidad económica para salir adelante con sus familias, se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos laboran en el comercio, aun conservan su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, forma parte del grupo de crédito Cochapamba desde hace 13 años, en todo este tiempo ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras y los créditos le han permitido mejorar poco a poco en su negocio.

La Señora. Blanca tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19 y 12 años y su ultimo hijo de apenas 8 meses de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudian en el colegio. Su esposo se dedica al área de la construcción ya que es de profesión albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Blanca se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de cerdos, pollos y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene en alguna necesidad económica o son para el consumo de su hogar. También desde hace algún tiempo está en el negocio de venta de verduras  ambulantemente. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras.

Su meta es tener un local propio para vender sus verduras.
texts.en:
The "Cochapamba" Communal Bank is made up of 7 hard-working female members who live in the Valle en Cuenca Parish; a place that is surrounded by vegetation, green fields and big landscapes thanks to its rugged geography. The architecture of this Parish is a mix of old and modern. The inhabitants, as well as the members, are kind and gentle and look to improve their economic situation every day in order to get ahead with their families. They dedicate themselves to agriculture and breeding and some work in commerce. Even so, they conserve their culture and traditions. 

One of the members is Blanca. She's been a member of the "Cochapamba" Communal Bank for 13 years and in all of that time has established a good friendship with all of the members. The loans they has received have helped her improve her business little by little. 

Blanca is 37 years old, married and has 3 children from her marriage. Her children are 19 and 12 years old and her youngest is 8 months old. Her first child is married and lives independently. Her second child is in school. Her husband works in construction and is a professional 
bricklayer. She owns the house she lives in. 

Blanca takes care of the household and breeds pigs, chickens and guinea pigs. They animals are for the consumption of the household, but in hard economic times she sells them. She has also been an itinerant vendor selling vegetables for some time now.

She will invest her loan in buying vegetables.

Her goal is to have her own business premises to sell her vegetables.

loans.use: buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma appreciates the previous loan with Kiva that improved her living standards, thanks to the profits she generated from her food stall. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale. She joined Yehu to obtain financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Nohemy Isabel

texts.es:
Nohemy, a sus 38 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos de 18 y 20 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias. Desde hace muchos años trabaja con su esposo en una finca, desempeñándose como mayordomos, esta actividad la alterna con la porcicultura, pues cría y engorda cerdos para la venta, con lo cual complementa sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. La titular es una mujer emprendedora, activa, pujante y muy trabajadora, la mayor parte del tiempo lo emplea en el cuidado de sus animales y realiza oficios varios en la casa de los dueños de la finca. 
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más lechones y concentrado para los animales, con esto pretender seguir con el cuidado de sus animales y podrá sacar una producción escalonada, que le genere ingresos mensuales constantes. De esta manera, tendrá la posibilidad de seguir avanzando hasta cumplir el sueño de ser totalmente independiente, que su negocio le genere los ingresos suficientes para poder ofrecer educación universitaria a sus hijos y además mejorar las condiciones de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Nohemy, age 38, has two children, ages 18 and 20.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her life partner.  She has lived in the countryside her whole life.  That is where she learned farming.  She has worked with her husband on a farm for many years.  They work as overseers.  She alternates this business activity with raising and fattening pigs to sell. This supplements her income in order to support her family.

She is an enterprising, active, vigorous, and very hard-working woman.  She spends most of her time taking care of her animals and doing the various jobs at the farm owners’ house.

She is requesting the loan to buy more piglets and concentrated feed for the animals.  With this she plans to continue caring for her animals, and she will be able to have a staggered production.  This will generate constant monthly income for her.

In this way she will have the chance to continue advancing until she fulfills her dream of being totally independent, of having her business generate enough income to be able to provide her children with a university education, and to improve the living conditions for her whole family.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and concentrated feed for the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cages, accessories, animal toys, concentrated feed, and medicines and to print advertising leaflets for her pet store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina. She previously obtained a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy supplies such as glass, stainless steel materials, silicon, and other materials used in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for the family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Rosalina would like to apply for another loan, this time for 51,000 PHP, to again buy supplies such as glass, stainless steel materials, silicon, and other materials for her business. Her business profits will definitely help her to meet both her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalina hopes to have a stockroom for all the supplies that she is buying for her business. She meets faithfully with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies such as glass, stainless steel materials, silicon, and other materials used in the business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a hardworking woman who lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a khanga sales business (selling wrap cloth for women), and her vision is to be a supplier of khanga in the region. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (wrap cloth for women) for resale.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida appreciates the previous loan that helped her earn profits from her vegetable stall. She is requesting 10,000 KES to purchase fruits, sacks of potatoes, and vegetables for resale. She thanks Yehu for their loan policy.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, sacks of potatoes, and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y el cuenta que al terminar la carrera piensa en montar un negocio propio manteniendo también su trabajo actual.
El estudio es sacrificado ya que no pasa mucho tiempo con mi familia, pues tiene sacrificarse para poder lograr su meta.
El solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma seguir estudiando.Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Francisco is from the city of Carapeguá. He is studying for a degree in Business Administration. Upon finishing his degree, he plans to start his own business while keeping his current job.

Studying requires sacrifice since he does not have much time to spend with his family. Therefore, he has made these sacrifices so that he can achieve his goal. Francisco is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university fees. This will enable him to continue studying. He is grateful for the opportunity he has received, since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es hijo único, vive con su madre en casa propia. Se dedica a la cría de ganado. Tiene como metas futura obtener su titulo universitario de Ingeniero Agrónomo, y cuenta que es consciente que a través del estudio y sacrificio logrará eso. De aquí a cierto tiempo se ve trabajando en una empresa multinacional y ejerciendo su carrera.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y dedicándose a sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mario is an only child who lives in his own home with his mother. He raises livestock. Mario has goals future goals, such as obtaining a university degree in Agricultural Engineering. He is aware that he can achieve his goal through study and sacrifice. Eventually he hopes to be working for a multinational company and utilizing his degree.

Mario is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his fees. This will enable him to continue his studies and dedicating himself to his coursework.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 63 years old.  She is married and has four children. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.  Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Rebecca has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Rebecca would like to save money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She also has a tricycle for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
This is Angeline, 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Christopher, a barker, and they have a child. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Angeline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Angeline hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of an abundant life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has three children, two of whom are in school and one who is still very young.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.  Asha sells paraffin, and she has been in the business for the last two years.  She sells to market dwellers.
She is requesting Ksh.20,000 to purchase sixty jerrycans of paraffin for resale.  She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sixty jerrycans of paraffin for resale

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She operates a retail shop and she has been in this business for over three years.  Her challenge is seasonality.
She is requesting for a loan of Ksh.20,000 to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, soap for resale.  She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, soap for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 49 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Martha se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores, además de ciertas golosinas como chicles, caramelos o galletas. Todos estos productos son adquiridos al contando y son vendidos en su casa a sus vecinos y pobladores quienes son sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 6 años dedicándose a este negocio y por el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo de su hija quien atiende a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su trabajo por los ingresos económicos que obtiene diariamente. Considera que su negocio es rentable por la demanda que tienen las bebidas debido al intenso calor que existe en la zona donde vive. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio incrementando la cantidad de gaseosas, así mismo desea incursionar en la venta de comidas regionales. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará gaseosas de diversas marcas, sabores y presentaciones para que siga vendiendo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a home of her own and they all life there together.  Martha sells soft drinks of different brands and flavors.  She also sells certain snacks such as gum, candy, and cookies.  She pays for everything in cash and sells from her home to her neighbors and locals who are her steady customers.  She has been doing this for more than six years and she only gets help from her daughter, who serves customers when [Martha] is away from home.  She likes her work because of the income she generates daily.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand for drinks due to the intense heat in the area where she lives.

She plans to expand her business by increasing the amount of soft drinks.  She also wants to start selling regional foods.  She is asking for a loan of S/1,500 and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support so she can feel more secure about advancing her business.  She is committed to making her payments on time and she will use the money to buy different brands and flavors of soft drinks and displays so she can continue selling from her home.

loans.use: to buy drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Salmo 121 Group

texts.es:
DUO Solidario SALMO 121
Doña Jesús es originaria de San Jose Poaquil ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de la localidad  desde hace años ella viene realizando esta actividad ya que es el único medio que ha tenido para salir adelante.
Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que con el apoyo de el ella se motiva para seguir realizando sus actividades.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes para obtener mejores ganancias,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y frutas para la venta ya que de esa forma ella podra salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Salmo 121 Solidarity Duo includes Jesús from San José Poaquil. She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables in the local municipal market. For years she has been carrying out this work because it is the only means that she has had to get ahead. 

Her husband makes a living in agriculture and thanks to his support, she continues forward with her business. With his his support she is motivated to continue carrying out this activity. Her dream is to expand her business to offer a greater variety of products for her customers in order to receive greater earnings. She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell so that she can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad  vive en casa propia con compañero de vida, su hijo y su nuera, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas desde hace varios años, lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por ser amable a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida y su hijo logran solventar algunos gastos del hogar, doña Ana  esta solicitado un crédito para la compra de  chicharrón, maíz, frijol, repollos, tomates, etc. para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband, her son, and her daughter in law.  She has been selling pupusas from her home for several years and has many customers because she’s friendly when making her sales.  She pays her bills with her profits and with help from her husband and son.  Ana is asking for this loan to buy pork rinds, dried corn, beans, cabbage, tomatoes, etc. so she can continue with her business and be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: elizabeth vive en casa de un familiar con su compañero de vida, ella tiene un negocio donde vende variedad de productos como refrescos, licuados, tostadas de plátanos también vende ropa su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por vender una variedad de productos también por la amabilidad a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, elizabeth esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi ella y su compañero de vida podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elizabeth lives with her life’s partner and she has a business where she sells a variety of products such as drinks, smoothies, plantain tostadas, and also clothing out of her home.  She has many customers because she sells such a variety, but also because she is friendly when she makes her sales.  She is able to pay the household expenses with her earnings.  Elizabeth is asking for a loan so she can buy more merchandise and be able to continue with her business, since it’s her only source of work.  This way she and her partner can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que cultiva granos básicos, tales como: abono, venenos, fóliales, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar su producción y los ingresos los invierte en los gastos básicos del hogar, asimismo en la educación de sus hijos. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y se encuentran muy bien con sus tres hijos, ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en: Magdalena needs a new loan because she needs to buy farming supplies, since she raises basic grains.  She needs fertilizer, weed killer, plants, and other things.  Her previous loan allowed her to increase production and she used her profits to pay for basic household needs and her children’s education.  Her financial conditions have improved and things are very well with her three children; she’s a single mother.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is married and has two children.  She lives in Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte with her family. Her husband works as a security guard in a private company while she runs a general store in their community to earn an extra income. Aside from this, they work together operating their own rice farm, their main source of income. Her husband takes care of the farm during weekends and days off with Daisy.  Recently, she joined Gata Daku MPC and she gains access to micro-finance services. She borrowed a loan of 10,000.00 PHP to buy fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs. She is hopeful to generate an abundant harvest with the help of this current loan. She also planned to save a portion of her revenue for the education of her children in the near future

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesús

texts.es: Rodrigo es un hombre, que a sus 55 años de edad se dedica a la comercialización de estopa, actividad que realiza desde el año 2004 y que aprendió cuando trabajaba como vendedor en una empresa.  Actualmente distribuye el producto a diferentes pueblos de Antioquia, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado. De esta manera ha logrado obtener los recursos para el sustento diario de su familia.  Rodrigo es un señor pujante, enérgico, trabajador, día a día lucha incansablemente para que su negocio funcione de la mejor manera posible y pueda sostenerse en el tiempo y, a pesar de los obstáculos que se le han presentado en algunos pueblos por problemas de orden público, él nunca se desanima, por el contrario, siempre busca opciones para seguir avanzando; es por ello que solicita un ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (estopa), así aprovechará el descuento que obtiene por comprar de contado, lo que le permitirá vender su producto a mejor precio y aumentar su margen de ganancia. Esto lo impulsará para seguir luchando en pro del cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es montar su negocio en un local, cercano a su casa y poder disfrutar su vejez de manera tranquila y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is fifty-five years old and makes a living marketing burlap sacks.  He has been doing this since 2004, and learned this trade while he was working as a seller for a company.

Presently, he distributes his product to different villages in Antioquia.  In order to do this, he relies on the help and support of one employee.  Through this work, he has been able to provide daily sustenance for his family.  

Rodrigo is a vigorous, energetic, and hardworking man.  Day to day, he fights tirelessly so that his business functions in the best way possible and so that it can continue in the long run.  Despite the obstacles that he has faced in some villages due to problems with public order, he has never become discouraged.  On the contrary, he always searches for options in order to continue moving forward.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan.  He hopes to invest in the purchase of burlap sacks wholesale, taking advantage of the discount that he can obtain by also paying in cash.  This would allow him to sell his product at a better price and thereby increase his profit margin.  

This will further motivate him to continue fighting in order to accomplish his greatest dream: to set up his business on shop premises close to his house, so that he can enjoy his old age in a calm setting and with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy burlap sacks wholesale.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario es un hombre, que  a sus 43 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Víctima del desplazamiento por la violencia que se presentó en su pueblo natal, llegó a la ciudad en 1992, en busca de nuevas oportunidades para salir adelante. Inició con la venta de ropa, de forma ambulante, gracias al apoyo y asesoría de algunas personas conocidas, de esta forma pudo ahorrar y montó su negocio en un pequeño puesto, ubicado en el centro de la ciudad donde vive; actualmente ofrece todo tipo de calzado y ropa masculina y femenina, aprovechando las ventajas de manejar su propio tiempo y estar ubicado en una zona bastante transitada, de esta forma ha logrado adquirir ingresos para el sustento diario.  Mario es un señor pujante, activo, emprendedor, lucha incansablemente para cumplir el sueño de tener su negocio en un local comercial bien reconocido y acreditado, con gran variedad de inventario disponible. Esto lo motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito, que será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (calzado, jeans, blusas, busos para dama, etc) con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de artículos para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos; para seguir luchando, tener mejor calidad de vida y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: At 43 years of age, Mario is single and doesn't have any children. He was a victim of displacement from the violence in his native town and arrived to the city in 1992, looking for new opportunities to get ahead. He started as an itinerant vendor selling clothing, thanks to the support and advice of some people he knew. He was able to save money and set up a business in a small stand located in the center of the city in which he lives. He currently offers all kinds of shoes and clothing for men and women. By taking advantage of the benefits of managing his own time and being located in a well-transited area, he's achieved the ability to make a living. Mario is a vigorous, active, enterprising man who has fought tirelessly to achieve his dream of having his own business, well-stocked with a variety of inventory, in a well-known, accredited, commercial location. This is what motivated him to request a loan, which he will invest in wholesale merchandise (shoes, jeans, blouses and women's sweatshirts), with the objective of continuing his business and offering a variety of articles to satisfy the needs and tastes of his clientele, of which will be seen reflected in the increase in sales, and thus, his income. He is motivated to keep fighting, improve his quality of life and achieve his goals.

loans.use: buy wholesale merchandise (shoes, jeans, blouses and women's sweatshirts).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen is 25 years old and lives with her husband and one child in a rural village in the Ponhea Krek district. Rice farming is the only source of income for her family; she has been doing this for about several years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 14,000 KHR but she is able to save 9,000 KHR each day.

This is the third loan for Hen with VIsionFund. With the successful loans in the past, she has been able to support her family with enough food. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes to earn more income from her rice business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pedro Jr.

texts.en:
Pedro Jr. is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two young children. Pedro Jr. has been in the rice farming business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income.

Pedro Jr. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting his yield and income. 

In the future, Pedro Jr. hopes to make his farming business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha operates a retail shop that sells household consumables, such as sugar, rice, beans, milk and flour. 

She is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase sacks of sugar, beans, rice, maize and soap for resale. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, beans, rice, maize and soap for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a first-time borrower who runs a tea-growing farm, which is his major source of income. He started growing tea in 1993 with hopes of using the profits from the business to educate his five children, who are all in school at the moment. His business is in his local cell of residence and his major clients are the traders in the area. He is a hard-working man but is faced with a challenge of weather which negatively affects the quantity he harvests and reduces his profit. Despite the challenge of weather, Robert is determined to carry on farming to be able to achieve his dreams. He hopes to use the loan money to buy fertilizer for his farm. The photo shows Robert on his tea farm.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his tea farm.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a hardworking, dynamic Iraqi client who is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Basem is a barber and owns a barber shop. Since an early age, Basem used to love this career, and hair-cutting was his hobby. He enrolled in this field and started to work at a barber shop as an employee and mastered this field. 

In 2006, after gaining all the needed experience, Basem established his own business and started to gradually grow in fame and respect in the neighborhood. 

Basem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop by installing ceramic blocks on the floor and on the walls of his shop. Basem is a very ambitious person. He is aiming to grow his business and provide a better income for his family so he may provide all of their needs.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, a sus 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa, quien le colabora en su negocio en el que fabrica todo tipo de velas y velones. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 18 años, gracias a los conocimientos que obtuvo cuando le colaboraba a un vecino en la fabricación de este producto, con lo cual ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades y gastos de su hogar. Jaime es un señor emprendedor, activo y trabajador, su actividad la realiza de Lunes a Sábados de 9:00 a, a 7:00 pm, y su producción es vendida a vecinos, tiendas e iglesias cercanas al sector donde reside. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (parafina y mecha) para así, aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene por compras de contado y, podrá vender su producto a mejor precio, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de su producción y sus ingresos. 
Jaime sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, posicionarlo a nivel regional y poder ofrecer oportunidades de empleo, además de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su esposa.
texts.en:
Jaime, 53, lives with his wife who also works with him in his candle-making business. He's been running this business for 18 years. Thanks to the knowledge he obtained from a neighbor who taught him how to manufacture this product, he's been able to afford his needs and household expenditures. Jaime is an enterprising, active, hard-working man. He runs his business Monday to Saturday from 9am to 7pm and sells his product to the neighborhood, stores and churches close to the area of his residence. He is requesting a loan to invest in wholesale supplies (paraffin wax and wicks) so he can take advantage of the discounts for buying with cash, and sell his product for a better price, which will be reflected in the increase of production and income. 

Jaime dreams of growing his business, positioning it at a regional level, offering job opportunities and enjoying an improved quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: buy wholesale supplies (paraffin wax and wicks).

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.en:
Stella, who is in her late 20s,is married with two children who are in school. For two years now, Stella has been running a mamalishe business offering cooked-food services. She is doing fine with her business and family as well. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair return per month. This will be Stella's fifth loan request which she will use to buy additional food cooking items. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she managed to buy more food cooking items. With the business profit received, she bought a refrigerator and paid school fees and household expenses. Stella dreams of owning a hotel. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " UFUNUO" which totals eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional food cooking items.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Luz Brillante Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO LUZ BRILLANTE
Doña Maria Luisa es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 28 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad estan sus 5 hijos menores de edad ella se dedica a la compra y venta de laurel y a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano.
