El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero, gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que entre los dos se ayudan para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y asi mandar a sus hijos a una mejor escuela para un futuro mejor.
Ella ya tuvo dos crédito KIVA y estuvo puntual con sus pagos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de laurel para la venta.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is one member of the "Brilliant Light Solidarity" partnership. She is originally from Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 28 years old and has five young children. Her primary work is the purchase and resale of bay leaves and the creation of traditional, hand-made weaving. 

Her husband is a day laborer, and thanks to his support she is able to continue with her business. Between the two of them, they manage to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her business, thus earning greater income and allowing her to send her children to a better school for a better future. She has had two Kiva loans before and was on time with her payments. She is requesting this loan to purchase bay leaves, which she will sell.

loans.use: purchase bay leaves for resale

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en: To earn a living, Jinalyn runs a hog-raising business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising hogs to sell. She decided to establish her business in order to generate income instead of just staying home and doing household chores. Jinalyn is 32 years old and married. She would like to expand her business but she has insufficient funds. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs. She hopes this loan will be granted so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Angelene

texts.en:
Angelene is a 27-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 8, while the youngest is 1. 

She operates a tricycle transport service, and has been operating the service for three years. Due to lack of capital to maintain her livelihood activity, Angelene requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy tires and pay for maintenance, like changing the oil, for a hassle-free ride.

In the future, Angelene would like to expand her tricycle transport services to improve her livelihood status and to continue send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for maintenance, like changing the oil.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Residing in the Trang district of Takeo province, Oun is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She has earned a living through selling grocery items and growing rice for almost 30 years. Her husband is a taxi-driver. Oun is able to earn about US$14 per day and she manages to save about US$5 each day after daily expenses.
Oun has been with VisionFund for two loans and successfully repaid the loans which have enabled her to improve her standard of living. Now, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund to cover the entire tuition fees for her son.  She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in school until graduation so he can get a good job and help support and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with four children; three are in school and one is still young. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She operates a retail shop that sells tea leaves, sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour, and her major challenges are seasonality and competition.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.10,000 to purchase sacks of sugar, beans, and wheat flour to sell. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, beans, and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has two children. Ahmad works hard to provide his family’s income while his children are students and continue their education. 

Ahmad owns a small shop where he sells glass plates which are used for the installation of display windows. He not only sells these glass blocks, but also specializes in their installation. Ahmad has a long experience in this field. In 1998, Ahmad established his own business. His business has grown rapidly because he is famous for this work, and he has a lot of experience. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his shop. Ahmad believes that through this renovation, he will be able to attract more customers and increase his production, so he will be able to improve the quality of life of his family and pay the tuition fees of his two children.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria con 40 años de edad es casada, madre de 3 hijos de los cuales los 2 mayores trabajan y la menor estudia en primaria. Con ella vive una nuera la cual ayuda con las diferentes actividades en el hogar la cual es un gran apoyo para que Doña Gloria pueda desplazarse hasta su área de trabajo en la cual se desempeña como enfermera en un hospital de la zona. EL trabajo de la agricultura lo aprendió a través de sus abuelos los cuales practican la agricultura de generación en generación hasta sus padres. La tierra que ella trabaja un parte es comprada y la otra fue una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual está a una distancia de 20 minutos de su casa de habitación trasladándose a pie involucrándose sus hijos ella mientras no trabaja en el hospital y su esposo.

Su sueño es ser la mejor y mayor productora de café de la zona, poder expandir su tierra por medio de la compra y sembrar una mejor variedad la cual pueda ser más competitiva en el mercado como el caturra, Borbone, que son atractivos para sus clientes de esa forma podrá percibir mayores ingresos y apoyar a su hija en los estudios. Es por ello que el día de hoy ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual planea comprar insumos agrícolas con los cuales podrá dar un mejor y mayor mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Gloria, 40, is married and the mother of three children.  The two older children work and the youngest is in elementary school.  A daughter-in-law lives with her, helping with the various household chores.  This is a big help because Gloria can go out to her job as a nurse in a hospital in the area.

She learned agricultural work through her grandparents, who farmed through the generations until her parents.  Part of the land she works was purchased and the rest was given to her by her parents.  It's about 20 minutes from her house on foot.  Her children and her husband are involved, as is she when she's not working in the hospital.

Her dreams are to be the best and biggest coffee producer in the area, to be able to expand her land through purchases, and to plant a better variety so she'll be more competitive in the market.  The Caturra and Bourbon varieties are attractive to her customers.  This way she'll be able to earn more income and support her children in their studies.

This is why today she has asked COMIXMUL for a loan to buy agricultural inputs to be able to give more and better care to her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy ready-to-wear products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in meeting their personal, household and business expenses. She also has a beauty salon.

She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy beauty products and hair products needed in her salon. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her work and  draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty products and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Villa Esther Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ESTHER”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Constancia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: panadería, servicio de limpieza, tejido de chompas de lana, albañil, venta de pan, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora constancia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de panadería; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió con ayuda de un familiar quien le dio el capital para emprender este negocio que en  la actualidad le ayuda a al sustento de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Villa Esther" will be starting its second term in Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as part of the Centro Focal of Santiago II. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a Board of Directors headed by Constancia, the president. The members have a wide variety of businesses, including a bakery, a cleaning service, bread sales, clothing sales, and the weaving of wool sweaters.

The loan will benefit the tiny businesses of the organization where Constance is a member. She said that they joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution. Currently, she runs a bakery, which helps to sustain her family. She learned how to run this business with the help of a family member who gave her the start-up capital.

This loan will be used to invest in capital through the purchase of flour, which she will get from one of the wholesaler vendors in the city of El Alto. After using the flour for baking, she will sell her products in her sales space. This work generates income for her that makes it possible for her to maintain her home and family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she liked the health assistance.

loans.use: purchase flour for her bakery.

loans.name: Anyhelo Geovanny

texts.es:
Ayhelo es un joven de 27 años y vive en la ciudad de Ica, es un joven muy trabajador, es por ello que trabaja muy duro en su labor como vigilante en una pequeña empresa de seguridad. Anyhelo trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.

Anyhelo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar materiales para construir un cuarto en la vivienda de sus padres, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida, así el seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Anyhelo is 27 years old and lives in the city of Ica. He is a hard-working young man, and works nine hours every day. He is employed as a guard for a small security business. With his income, he helps his parents with the household expenses.

Anyhelo is very grateful for the Kiva microloans. With the support shown by the loan, he will be able to purchase materials to build a room in his parents' home. This will improve his quality of living and ensure that he can keep working towards his larger goal of having his own house.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Sofía Dávila Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOFÍA DÁVILA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de artículos varios, venta de pescado, venta de carpas, tejido de mantas, carnicería, hilado de alpaca, tienda de barrio, venta de verdura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que es el cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus hijas, que ya realizan esta actividad, posteriormente ella decide implementar su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sofía Dávila Communal Bank will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  It's made up of 11 members and governed by a board of directors of which Hilaria's the president.  The businesses of the communal bank members are varied and include food sales, a variety store, fish sales, tent sales, blanket weaving, a butcher shop, alpaca yarn, a neighborhood store, and vegetable sales.

The loan they'll get will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Hilaria.  She says this is the fourth cycle she has been with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a facilator from the institution who visited her at her house.

Currently she has a business selling meat.  She says she learned the business from her daughters, because they do this work.  Later she decided to set up her own sales space.
 
The loan she'll get is to increase her capital by buying meat, which she'll get from the distributors in the city of El Alto and then sell in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources for her family, because she's married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the savings.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Sra. Rita de 43 anos de idade, casada e tem 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a escola no ensino primario, 1 sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ela e Operaria Agricola numa empresa de producao de banana.
O presente empréstimo será maioritariamente aplicado na compra de material de construção (blocos,cimento,janelas mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa e uma pequena parte será tambem usado para compra de bens (tv, mesa de 6 cadeiras) para sua casa.
texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom attend elementary school and one hasn't reached school age yet. She's a farm worker for a banana company.
The current loan will be mainly used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement and windows) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house. Also, a small part of it will be used to purchase goods (a TV set and a 6-seater table) for her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement and windows), to pay for labor and to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Nohemy De Jesús

texts.es: Nohemy, a sus 51 años de edad es casada y madre de un hijo de 23 años. Toda su vida productiva la dedicó a laborar en empresas de confección, donde obtuvo conocimientos y amplia experiencia. Pero hace 2 años, cansada de la explotación laboral a la que se veía expuesta en su último empleo, ella decidió independizarse y montó su propio taller de confección, elaborando ropa interior para niñas y damas, con su línea propia, además cuenta con el apoyo de 2 empleadas directas. De esta manera ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar económicamente al sostenimiento de su hogar. Nohemy es una mujer trabajadora, pujante, creativa, siempre está en busca de opciones que le permitan crecer y progresar, por lo que se motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito, que será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y sacar más producción, para tener variedad de prendas que satisfagan el gusto de sus clientes; esto se verá representado en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende, sus ingresos, con los que desea apoyar a su hijo para que estudie una carrera universitaria y pueda tener un futuro próspero. Además sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y poder generar más oportunidades de empleo, que mejore la calidad de vida tanto de su familia, como la de otras personas.
texts.en: Nohemy, 51, is a married mother of one son aged 23 years. She has dedicated all of her productive years to working in sewing factories, where she obtained knowledge and experience. But two years ago, tired of being exploited at her last job, she decided to go on as an independent and opened her own sewing workshop. She has her own line of under garments for girls and women and has the help of two employees, both whom she directly employs. She now makes a living with her business. Nohemy is a hard-working, vigorous, creative woman who is always looking for options to help her grow and progress, which is why she is requesting a loan. She will invest the loan in wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, elastics) with the goal of continuing her business and increasing production so she will have a variety of clothing to satisfy the tastes of her clients, which will be represented by the increase in sales, and thus, her income. She hopes to support her son so he goes to university and can have a prosperous future. She also dreams of growing her business and generating more job opportunities in order to improve her family's quality of life as well as other people's.

loans.use: buy wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, elastics).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es de Portoviejo.  Lleva 20 años trabajando en este negocio y escogió esta actividad, debido a que su padre trabajo en lo mismo.  Trabaja todos lo días con la ayuda de un empleado.  Es soltero y no tienen hijos.  En un futuro le gustaría comprar ganado, que produzca y le dé leche a diario; así como vender vacas a otros productores.  Ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para la compra de caña, palancas y cade.
texts.en: The client is from Portoviejo. He has 20 years working in this business and chose this activity due to the fact that his father worked in it. He works every day with the help of an employee. He is single and has no children. In the future he would like to buy cattle that will produce and give him milk every day, and enable him to sell cows to other producers. Now he needs the money from the loan to purchase sugar cane, levers and chains.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane, levers and chains.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn, age 42, lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district. She has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are farmers who plant cassava on four hectares of farmland. Having engaged in this business for 23 years, Sophorn can earn about 53,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Sophorn with VisionFund. The past loan, which she completely repaid, has helped her relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her cassava plantation. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to continue making a living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O Sr. Armando de 46 anos de idade, casado e tem 4 filhos dos quais 1 e já independente e 3 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário . Ele é negociante há mais de 10 anos, vende produtos da primeira necessidade, uma actividade que esta sendo acompanhada com a sua esposa.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos da primeira necessidade (feijão, detergente de lavar a roupa, ovos e açúcar) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio. 
O Sr. Armando alem de ser negociante de produtos da primeira necessidade é também fabricante de piloes, e por sua vez vende esses piloes nos mercados da cidade de Maputo e Boane.
texts.en:
Armando is 46 years old and married. He has four children, one of whom is already independent and three attend primary and high school. He has been a trader for over 10 years. He sells products that are household staples, a business he's been running alongside his wife.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples (beans, laundry detergent, eggs and sugar) in order to increase his turnover.
Aside from selling household staples, Armando also manufactures pestles, which he then sells in the markets of the towns of Maputo and Boane.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (beans, laundry detergent, eggs and sugar) in order to increase his turnover.

loans.name: Sinuch's Group

texts.en:
Sinuch, 27, is married, with one son, residing in a rural village of the EK Phnom district, of Battambang province. To support the family, he and his wife have been farming rice and selling fish for three years.

Sinuch’s Group consists of two members, one male, one female, and they both have been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle. Sinuch completely paid back the loan with VisionFund Cambodia and successfully used the loan to better support his family. 

He and his group member are applying for a loan of KHR 1,200,000 and KHR 1,000,000, respectively. Sinuch will use his portion to buy pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow more rice to increase his family’s income, to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 23 years of age and married. She and her husband are harmoniously residing together with their two children at the village of Union. 

Mary Jane has been running her retail business for almost a year and has already built close relationships with her suppliers and customers. She is now requesting loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase shoes, dresses, cosmetics and soap. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, dresses, cosmetics and soaps.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Marta tem 28 anos de idade, é viúva e mãe de 2 filhos todos a estudarem. Vive na casa própria com apenas um dos filhos pois o outro  vive na casa da avo e a Marta envia por vezes produtos para o seu sustento.
Com o valor do credito irá comprar mesas e cadeiras plásticas para revender e por encomendas. 
No futuro quer terminar sua casa, crescer no negócio e tendo um outro terreno no futuro irá construir dependências para arrendar.
 Gostaria de honrar com o contrato e voltar a pedir mais empréstimos para realização dos seus planos.
texts.en:
Marta is 28 years old and a widow. She has two children who attend school. She lives with one of her children in a house that she owns. The other son lives with his grandmother, and sometimes Marta sends goods to support him.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase plastic chairs and tables for re-selling by order.
In the future she wishes to finish building her house and make her business grow. Since she owns another plot of land, in the future she'll build rooms for renting out.
She'd like to honor the commitment and apply for more loans again so she can accomplish her plans.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs and tables for re-selling.

loans.name: Laurinda

texts.pt:
Laurinda  tem 32 anos de idade é divorciada mãe de 2 filhos que estudam .Vive na casa própria e  é trabalhadora  duma empresa do ramo agrícola.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar chapas de zinco, cimento, janelas para a sua casa tipo 1. 
No futuro quer ampliar a casa e fazer casas de banho melhoradas.
Diz que gostaria de pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar as condições de de vida de sua família.
texts.en:
Laurinda is 32 years old and divorced. She has two children who study. She lives in a house that she owns and works for an agricultural company.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase metal sheets, cement and windows for her one-bedroom house.
In the future she wishes to enlarge her house and build better bathrooms.
She states that she'd like to make her repayments in a timely fashion and apply for more loans again so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, cement and windows for her house.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha appreciates the benefit of the previous loan that she took from Kiva, which helped her generate more profit from her business. Now, she is requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of KES 10,000. Like the previous one, she will use this loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits to resell, including sacks of potatoes. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to resell, including sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Cremilde

texts.pt: A senhora Cremilde tem 53 anos de idade e tem 3 filhos. É negociante há mais de 10 anos e modista há mais de 30 anos e vive na casa própria. Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar cimento, areia, varões e estribos para construção de uma dependência para arrendar. No futuro pretende construir um atelier de moda para acomodar melhor os seus clientes. Promete fazer o máximo para pagar melhor para voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en: Cremilde is 53 years old and has three children. She has been a trader for over 10 years and a dressmaker for over 30 years. She lives in a house that she owns. With the money from the loan she'll purchase cement, sand, rods and brackets so she can build a room for renting out. In the future she wishes to build a dressmaking shop in order to better accommodate her customers. She pledges to do her best to make her repayments so that she can request more loans again.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rods and brackets so that she can build a room.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
A Senhora Angélica é casada, tem 54 anos de idade e tem 7 filhos maiores. Para custear as despesas depende da pensão do esposo e das receitas de arrendamento de algumas dependências que tem para alugar na sua casa.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será utilizado na compra de tubos e outras despesas para canalização de água.
No futuro pretende construir mais dependências para arrendar e quer continuar a ser cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Angélica is married. She's 54 years old and has seven adult children. In order to afford her expenses she depends on her husband's pension and the profits she makes from the lease on some rooms she has available for rent in her house.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase tubes and other items for water piping.
In the future she intends to build more rooms for renting out. She wishes to continue being a client of Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to purchase tubes and other items for water piping.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 50, lives in Pursat, a province of Cambodia which is located in the western part of the country. Chea is a married woman who has lived through much adversity in life; but this has made her struggle every day to get ahead and offer a better quality of life to her children. She loves them very much and doesn’t want them to encounter hard experiences like she has. Three of them are married and the other two are her dependents. Through much effort and perseverance, she started a retail business in a market of her region. In this way she is able to support her family members, earning approximately of 10.00 US dollars per day.

Chea heard about HKL froma  credit agent, and she decided she wanted to receive a loan to build a bathroom. This will improve her family's quality of life because currently there is no bathroom in the house. Her loan not only benefits her family, but also the surrounding environment by keeping it clean and minimizing disease. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for this loan support.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is aged 52 years and widowed with three dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district earning a living through farming rice. She can earn about KHR23,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR9,000 each day for the future needs.
This is Touch's first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Touch is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheets and blankets.

loans.name: Anastancia

texts.pt:
Anastancia tem 42 anos de idade, é viuvá e tem 2 filhos que estudam 9 e 5 classes. Anastancia é criadora de frangos para revenda na sua casa e pretende aplicar o dinheiro do empréstimo na compra de pintos, ração e vitaminas para dar continuidade à criação de frangos.
A  esperança e sonho da cliente é de continuar com a criação de frangos uma vez vez que  é uma actividade que vem praticando há bastante tempo.
texts.en:
Anastancia is 42 years old and a widow. She has two children who attend 9th and 5th grades. In her house, Anastancia raises chickens for re-selling. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins so that she can keep her poultry business going.
Her dream and her hope is to continue raising chickens, since it's a business she's been running for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es:
Marcosa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana, ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo y el departamento de Cusco, Perú.


Marcosa continúa en el  Banco Comunal y con sus principales actividades económicas como la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, pollos y gallinas. 

Marcosa está solicitando un préstamo de dinero que será invertido en la compra de pequeños animales como cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
Marcosa, 42, is married with six children. She lives in the community of Jajahuana, which is located in the district of Challabamba, in the province of Paucartambo, which is in the department of Cusco in Peru.

Marcosa is still a member of the Communal Bank and her principal business is agriculture and breeding small animals, like guinea pigs, chickens and hens.

Marcos is requesting a loan that she will invest in buying small animals, like guinea pigs and hens.

loans.use: buy small animals, like guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Kabini

texts.en:
Kabini appreciates the previous loan she took from Yehu that generated profits in her retail shop and thereby improved her living standards.

Now, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase soap, sacks of beans, rice and maize, sugar and cooking oil to resell. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase soap, sacks of beans, rice and maize, sugar and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married Iraqi youth client who is 22 years old and has one child. Ali lives with his family members consisting of four members, three of whom help Ali in providing the monthly income. 

Ali owns a carpenter’s shop; he specializes in making furniture. Ali has been in this field since 2000, and though practice he gained much experience in this field. He now has an employee, and is well-known in his neighborhood thanks to his competitive and affordable prices. 

Ali is applying for a youth loan of 2,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy a wood-cutting machine. 

Ali is aiming to expand in this field and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a wood-cutting machine

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang, 61, is married and has one child. She resides in a rural village located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the past 40 years, she has been selling grocery items. She can earn about 26,000KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

Heang has been with VisionFund for six previous loan cycles, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. The past loans from VisionFund helped Heang to better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Heang plans to use her portion of the loan funds to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucha es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía en canastilla, venta de coca, tienda surtida, costura de chalecos, tejido de macramé, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucha es integrante, ella indica que es el cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una Asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejido de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendio de un trabajo anterior y hace diez años decide implementar su propio taller ya que también estudio emprendimiento en una institución.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Flor Kantuta" communal bank will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamerican Regional Office. The group is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Señora Lucha is the Secretary. The businesses that the association's members run are varied and include, among others: craft baskets, coca sales, a general store, sewing vests, macramé knitting, sewing backpacks. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit microentrepreneurs like Señora Lucha. She says that this is her fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a credit counsellor from the institution who visited her at home. Currently she has an artisan business knitting sweaters. She makes it known that she learned this business from a previous job, and it has been ten years since she decided to start her own workshop, as she had also studied entrepreneurship. 

The loan she is taking out now is to increase the capital (the purchase of wool) she will acquire from distributors in the city of El Alto; after making the sweaters, she will sell them in her shop. This work allows her to generate income for her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the training.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Kakakuona Group

texts.en:
Method, who is in his early 30s, is single with one son who is still going to school. He has been running a retail shop for nine years now. He works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Method's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his shop's inventory and has paid back all of his loans successfully. He used the profit to build his house and pay school fees and household expenses. He will use this loan to restock his retail shop. He dreams of expanding his business into a supermarket.

Method will share this loan with the ten members of his loan group Kakakuona, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock items in the retail shop.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar, 36, is a married client from Iraq. He works hard to provide for his family’s needs, working in his grocery store. In his grocery store, Haydar offers to provide all the basic products a family may need, like dairy products, juices, canned foods, snacks, shampoos and detergents. He established his business in 2008. He had gained all the needed experience, by working at a similar grocery store for several years previously. Haydar has gained a good reputation in his neighborhood, thanks to the good quality and competitive prices of the goods he offers for sale.

Haydar is requesting a loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to renovate and expand his grocery store, from inside. Haydar believes that this loan will enable him to increase his sales of goods. Thus, the loan will result in the improvement of his business and his profits, and will give him the ability to provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his grocery store, from inside

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sitha is 24 years old and married. She has earned a living through farming rice for five years. She can earn about 7,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 3,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the fourth loan with VisionFund for Sitha. She has successfully repaid her previous loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis continúa con sus actividades como la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería entonces él sigue cultivando productos secos como por ejemplo papa, cebada, trigo y otros. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas. 
   
Luis nació en el distrito de Maras pero ahora vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 55 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos de la cuales tres están a su lado pero los demás son independientes.
texts.en:
Luis continues with his business in agriculture, breeding small animals and livestock. He continues cultivating dry products like potatoes, barley, corn and other items. He's been running his business for 17 years and it's going very well. On this occasion, he's requesting a loan to buy seeds.

Luis was born in the Maras district, but now lives in the community of Jajahuana. (The community of Jajahuana is located in the District of Challabamba, in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, in Perú). Luis is 55 years old and in a common-law relationship. He has seven children, three of whom live with him, while the rest are independent.

loans.use: buy seeds.

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Fallah is a married client from Iraq. He is 34 years old and the father of two children, for whom he works hard to provide. Fallah owns a butcher shop. He sells fresh meat. He established his business in 2012, having gained his experience by working at another butcher's shop for several years. Fallah now has hired an employee. Fallah is well-known in the market, thanks to his fresh meats and affordable prices.

Fallah is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use it to renovate his butcher shop, by installing ceramic tile on the walls and on the floor. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his butcher shop, by installing ceramic tile on the walls and on the floor

loans.name: Pompia

texts.en:
Pompia earns a living by owning and operating her sari-sari (variety store), selling various goods to the people in her area, San Miguel, Bohol. Pompia is a married woman and a mother of four children.
 
Pompia is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy more stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, eggs and cooking ingredients. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more customers and buyers to her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell at her store, including canned goods, soap and toiletries, and eggs

loans.name: Nuwwar

texts.en:
Nuwwar is an Iraqi youth client. He is 24 years old, married, and the father of a child. Nuwwar is the sole provider of the family. He owns a small shop, where he sells and changes engine oils and filters. He has been in this field since 2004 and has gained much experience in the skills he practices. Nuwwar's business has been growing fast in his neighborhood, and he has been gaining an excellent reputation.

Nuwwar is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop, by installing a rolling shutter and an external ceiling. He is aiming to improve his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to educate his child and take care of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to renovate his shop, by installing a rolling shutter and an external ceiling

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu appreciates the benefits of the previous loan, which helped her in the fish preparing and selling business. Using the loan, she generated profits that improved her living standard.

She is requesting to borrow KES 20,000 now. She will use this new loan to purchase different kinds of fish, cooking oil, and fuel for her fish cooking business. She thanks Yehu for the loan policies.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish, cooking oil, and fuel for her fish cooking business

loans.name: Rasoul

texts.en:
Rasoul is an Iraqi youth client. He is 24 years old, married and the father of two children. Rasoul works hard to provide his family’s income while his wife takes care of their children.

Rasoul owns a shop where he sells herbal medicines, shampoos, soaps and creams. He established his business in 2012 and gained his experience from his father who used to work in a similar field. Rasoul has much experience in this field. He employs a hired worker. Rasoul is well-known in the market and has an excellent reputation.

Rasoul is applying for a youth loan of 3,000 USD, which he will use to pay the annual rent for his shop. He aims to grow in this field and increase his profits so that he may provide his family’s needs and educate his two children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop

loans.name: Geno

texts.es:
Geno es un hombre de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos pequeñas hijas, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable,trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Geno no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba.
por iniciativa propia, Geno trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, adicionalmente por las tardes trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, Geno trabaja todos los dias por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Geno se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera Geno atenderá a mas clientes y tendrá mayores ganancias, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijas convertidas en buenas profesionales.
texts.en: Geno, 29, lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and two small daughters whom he loves and who are his purpose in life. He's a kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, Geno was not able to study the degree in Business Administration he so desired because he didn't have the financial resources and needed to start working at a young age. On his own initiative, Geno works in his small grocery store and in the afternoons he works as a taxi driver. Geno works approximately 12 hours a day, every day and believes business is going well because of his effort and dedication. Geno is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thankful for the help. He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to stock his business, that way Geno can serve more clients and increase his earnings. He'll continue working and making an effort to achieve his dream of seeing his daughters turn into professionals.

loans.use: buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sol's Group

texts.en:
Sol, 34, lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family’s income is from leasing a rice paddy. She has been in this business for over 10 years, to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 28,000 per day. Of this amount, she manages to save about KHR 20,000 per day for future needs.

Sol is just in her first loan cycle with VisoinFund. Now she is leading her group, to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With profits from this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland to increase her business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda is 21 years old and single, and she lives with with her entire family.  She is a hair dresser, and in the past she worked for others, to gain her experience and income. Now she feels that she is experienced enough to start her own business. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Euro, which she will use to start her hair dressing business, purchasing equipment like chairs and mirrors, as well as other tools of the trade. She has a lot of customers from her previous job, because she is very hardworking and friendly and always showed how much she enjoys her work and keeping her clients satisfied. Her goal is to expand her business in the future and to be able to hire an employee. She hopes to get married in the future. She wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase equipment like chairs and mirrors, as well as other tools for her new hair dressing business

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is a 40-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol and the father of a 5 month old baby girl. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells various goods like coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods and soap. He has been running  a sari-sari store for more than 5 years. Bonifacio has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more stock, like eggs, cooking oil, noodles and canned goods in order to attract more customers and increase his income. Bonifacio hopes that he will be able to provide his growing child with a quality education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like eggs, cooking oil, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Virginia Soledad

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 37 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 9 años al cual ama muchísimo y por el cual lucha cada día para poder sacarlo adelante. Día a día Virginia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y porque a pesar de los obstáculos sigue adelante.

Gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas kiva, Virginia podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder mejorar su vivienda, así podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y seguir adelante para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda, darle una buena educación a su hijo y llegar a ser supervisora de campo”.
texts.en:
Virginia is 37 years old and lives with her nine-year-old son, whom she loves very much and for whom she fights to provide for every day. Virginia works every day as a field hand for an agricultural holding in her city. She works around nine hours each day. She believes that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and because she overcomes all obstacles.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Virginia will buy construction materials to improve her home and give her son a better quality of life. She wants to keep improving her life and to realize her greatest dream, which is to finish construction of her home, give a good education to her son and become a supervisor in her job.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Fleyha

texts.en: Fleyha is a married woman from Iraq who is 48 years old and has three children. She assists her husband in providing the family income. Fleyha is a tailor and works from home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child, but in 2005 she took her tailoring to a new level and started sewing clothes for a living. She has good experience in this field. Fleyha is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. She will use this loan to buy 2 specialized sewing machines. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. In doing so, she will be able to educate her children, and assist her husband in providing for their family’s needs in order to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy 2 specialized sewing machines.

loans.name: Duo Solidario 4 De Febrero Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario 4 de Febrero este grupo esta conformado por la señora Beatriz de 39 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años, ella esta muy contenta ya que Kiva Fape le a ayudado mucho en su negocio por medio de creditos, es una persona muy responsable y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa en bariedad y en diferentes estilos esperando que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Beatriz is one member of the solidarity partnership “4 de Febrero” [February 4]. She is 39 years old, and she has worked selling clothing for five years now. She says that she is very happy because Kiva and the field partner have helped her a lot with loans for her business. Beatriz says that she is very responsible. She is requesting this loan to buy clothing in a variety of different styles. She hopes that she will again receive help through the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
This is Elvis. His previous loan was a big help for his business. He was able to buy all the needed products for his variety store. His income from his business helped him with sending his children to school and also with their everyday expenses. He and his wife are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which he will utilize to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Elvis dreams to be more successful in his business and hopes to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Noelali

texts.es: Noelali, de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Noelali se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano. Para obtener las prendas que vende envía cierta cantidad de dinero a otra ciudad y desde ahí le mandan todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ya sean polos, pantalones, blusas, faldas y camisas. De manera constante traslada toda su mercadería hacia los pueblos alejados de la ciudad en viajes que pueden llevar más de 5 horas por el río. Tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos que le permiten solventar los gastos de su familia, asimismo su actividad le permite sentirse ocupada siempre. Tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, además quiere tener otras actividades como la venta de gaseosas o desayunos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de segunda mano al por mayor conformados por vestidos, pantalones, blusas y polos para que siga trabajando.
texts.en: Noelali is 49 years old and is the single mother of two children who live with her in a rented home.  Noelali sells second hand clothing.  In order to acquire her merchandise, she sends a certain amount of money to another city and they send her all types of clothing for men, women, and children, including polo shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and shirts.  She constantly takes her merchandise around to the nearby towns, with trips that can last more than five hours by river.  She has been doing this for more than 20 years and she does it alone. She likes her business because it generates the income that allows her to pay her family expenses and she keeps busy.  She has plans to grow her business and she also wants to have other activities, such as selling drinks or breakfast.  She is asking for a loan of S/ 2,000 and she is grateful for the opportunity to solidify her plans.  She will use the money to buy second hand clothing, mainly dresses, pants, blouses, and polo shirts, so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar con su madre y su hermana, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor como: faldas, blusas, vestidos, etc. para incrementar mas sus ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: She lives at a relative’s house with her sister and family and sells clothing on foot through different neighborhoods near her home.  She is able to use the profits to help with the household expenses and is asking for a loan to buy more clothing, such as skirts, blouses, dresses, etc. to increase her profits and continue to help with the household expenses without limits.

loans.use: to buy clothing,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo para la agricultura, ya que desea preparar la tierra para el cultivo de maíz, pipián, ajonjolí; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: semilla, abono, venenos, fóliales y pago de mozos.
El préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que logro cultivar la pipianera, luego cultivo el maíz. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que los ingresos se han optimizado.   Su deseo es agregar otro tipo de  cultivo, ampliar su producción, mejorar la vivienda y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar needs a new loan for farming.  He wants to prepare the land for raising corn, peppers, and sesame seed.  This loan will help him buy the supplies he needs, such as seeds, fertilizer, poisons, plants, and pay for field hands.

The previous loan was helpful and he was able to raise peppers, then corn.  Financial conditions have improved because the income has optimized.  He wants to add another type of crop, expand his production, make improvements to his home, and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Nolvia

texts.es:
Maria Nolvia es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven en su casa de habitación ya que son menores de edad. Con 5 años de educación primaria ella lucha diariamente en compañía de su compañero de hogar para que sus hijos no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud paso apoyándoles en todo lo que puede y lo necesario para que a ellos no les falte nada. Ella se dedica especialmente al cultivo de café desde muy joven teniendo mucha experiencia en el cultivo de este y otros productos como el maíz y los frijoles. La tierra que en compañía de su pareja de hogar trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo físico y algunas restricciones por muchos años para obtener un terreno de forma propia y evitar pagar alquiler de tierras para sacar adelante su familia la cual está ubicada en la misma propiedad donde ella y su familia habitan siendo ellos 2 los únicos que se involucran es las diferentes actividades del campo.

Sus metas y sueños son las de darle a sus hijos una buena educación un buen futuro con el cual ellos puedan tener como la mejor arma para el día de mañana. Es por ello que ella lucha día a día y hoy ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra insumos agrícolas como: formula cafetalera, formula de crecimiento, formula 18-46-0 y urea que ayudara a darles un excelente y satisfactorio mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que los ingresos para su familia dependen de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Maria Nolvia is a farmer, housewife, and mother of two minor children who live with her.  She has a fifth grade education and works hard with her domestic partner every day so that the children don’t have to face the same situation that she faced in her youth.  They support them so that they are in need of nothing.  She has been raising coffee since she was very young and has lots of experience in raising this and other products such as corn and beans.  The land belongs to her and her partner, thanks to their physical efforts and some restrictions over the years so they can own their own land and not have to pay rent to get their family ahead.  They also live on the land and the two of them are the only ones who work the fields.

Her goals are to provide a good education for her children and a good future so they can be ready for tomorrow.  This is why she works so hard every day.  She is asking for a loan through COMIXMUL so she can buy farming supplies such as coffee fertilizer, growth formula, formula 18-46-0, and urea to help maintain her coffee crop.  Her family income depends on this.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Georges Francis

texts.fr: Georges est un jeune homme de 38 ans et père de 02 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 01 et03 ans. il est propriétaire d'une mini-quincaillerie dans un marché de la place.étant donné que la vente de certains produits est lente il est confronté à un problème d'écoulement de stock .raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock en achetant le materiel de plomberie qui semble s'écouler en permanence.ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la clientèèle. en plus les bénéfices qui en résulteront lui permettront de rendre son point de vente plus acttrayant de telle enseigne que sa quincaillerie acquiert une certaine notoriété dans cette zone,de même que garantir la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Georges is a young 38-year-old man, father of two children whose ages range from from one to three years.

He owns a mini-hardware store in a local market. As the sale of certain products is slow he is facing a flow of stock problem. 

The reason for requesting a loan is to increase his stock by purchasing the plumbing equipment which seems to be continually in demand. This will enable him to satisfy his customers. 

The resulting benefits will enable him to make his point of sale more attractive so that his hardware store becomes renowned in this area, and also ensure his children's education.

loans.use: Increase his stock supply by purchasing plumbing materials

loans.name: Mashkour

texts.en:
Mashkour is a 63-year-old Iraqi client who is married and has three children. Mashkour owns a small laboratory where he specializes in taking samples of blood from his patients, analyzes them and accordingly gives specific medicines for their problems. After taking many courses in this field, Mashkour established his business in 1998. Since he is the only person in the surrounding area with such a profession, Mashkour gained much fame and became well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. 

Mashkour is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD in order to pay the annual rent of his laboratory. He is aiming to continue providing health services for his neighborhood and also to teach others this profession so there will be more specialized and well-experienced people in his neighborhood who work in this career.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his laboratory.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a hardworking youth client from Iraq. He is 22 years old and lives with his family composed of four members. Malek helps his father in providing the family’s monthly income with the profit he gains from his grocery store.

In his grocery store, Malek sell various types of goods like dairy products, snacks, drinks and detergents. He has been in this field since 2005 and through practice, he gained good experience. Malek has a good reputation in the neighborhood and is loved by many since he took the responsibility in helping his parents at his young age.

Malek is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 USD, which he will use to buy an extra refrigerator as well as to increase his inventory. Malek is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may continue helping his parents and start saving for his future.

loans.use: to buy an extra refrigerator as well as to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 32 years old and married, and they are blessed with three children. To earn a living, Anabel is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for almost five years and usually earns about 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per piglet. 

Anabel wants to have more piglets to raise; in this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. Anabel hopes to sustain the needs of her hogs as well as her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Georges

texts.fr: Georges est un jeune homme de 27 ans et père de 02 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 03 et 08 ans. il s'est installé à so propre compte en optant pour la prestation des services de cablages dans un quartier de la place.étant donné que le materiel nécessiare à on activité coûte un peu cher,il est donc confronté à un problème constant de manque de materiel et par conséquent ne satisfait pas sa clientèle.raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit acheter le stock en achetant le materiel de cablage.ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la clientèle. les bénéfices qui en résulteront lui permettront d'étendre le réseau de distribution. en plus il aimerait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille
texts.en:
Georges is a young 27-year-old man, father of two children whose ages range from three to eight years. He chose to become an independant provider of cabling services in a local neighborhood.

Given that the material required for his business activity is somewhat expensive, he is continually confronted by shortage problems, and consequently is unable to satisfy his customers.

This is the reason for which he is requesting a loan: to establish a stock supply by buying the necessary cabling material, which will enable him to satisfy his customers.

The resulting profits will enable him to expand the distribution network. He would also like to improve his small family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy wiring material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy electronic parts to repair televisions, radios ...

loans.name: Nysret

texts.en:
Nysret is 32 years old and single. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo with his entire family. He is a very hard worker who does a lot to earn a living. For more than three years, Nysret has worked in an agricultural business. In the past, he used to buy and sell cows, buying them cheap and then turning them over at a higher price to make a profit. Now he has managed to build and keep a stable for the cows, and it is for this reason that Nysret is requesting a loan for the first time in order to purchase a cow. He also claims that he has been the only one who has financially supported his family. 

He is requesting a loan so that he may purchase additional cows and expand his business and save money for his family’s future. His goal is that when he adds more cows, he will then be able to sell the milk and milk products. He wants to thank all of the lenders and is very appreciative for the help.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth owns a pharmacy that sells various medicines, including farm chemicals, and it is doing very well. Ruth is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase various types of medicines and farm chemicals for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial suppot.

loans.use: to purchase various types of medicines and farm chemicals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Laure's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé 3 femmes qui se sont connues en faisant de la tontine ensemble. Elles ont déjà obtenu 4 précédent prêts chez ALIDé, tous ayant été remboursés sans aucun problème.

Laure, la représentant du groupe, a 47 ans et est mariée avec Jules, qui est maçon.
Ensemble, ils ont eu 3 enfants, dont certains sont encore scolarisés.

Depuis près de 10 ans, elle achète du maïs au marché de son village afin d'en faire des Akassas (une pâte très et les vendre à son domicile

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte développer son activité en achetant plus de provisions et utiliser les bénéfices générés pour acheter sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
This group consists of three women who became acquainted by participating in the same tontine (rotating loan association). They have already been granted four previous loans from ALIDé, all of which were repaid without any problems.

Laure, the representative of the group, is 47 years old and is married with Jules, who is a mason. Together they had three children, some of whom are still in school.

For nearly 10 years she has been buying corn from the village market to make Akassa (thick cornmeal porridge) she sells from her home.

With this new loan she hopes to develop her business by buying more supplies. She plans to use the profits generated to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: buy corn to make Akassa paste

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Kunthea is 26 years old and married. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR 65,000 to support her family and she can save about KHR 30,000 per day for future needs. 
This is the first loan for Kunthea’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. Kunthea will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Norm is aged 40 years and married with five children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for ten years, she manages to earn about 46,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 
This is a group loan for Norm’s group of three who are female and it is their first loan with VisionFund this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Norm wants to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 52 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 children aged 16 and 20. She engages in fishing and sells her catch.  She has  been into this fishing business for more than 10 years. Due to lack of capital to finance her livelihood activity, Carmelita requested a loan of 9000 PHP to buy materials like a fishing net, floaters and nylon to improve her catch and income.  In the future, Carmelita hopes that she could pay her weekly dues and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials like a fishing net, floaters and nylon

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es Abogada, es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una mujer con grandes ideales de poder seguir creciendo y estudiando. Ella ya es una profesional, pero quiere seguir estudiando y culturizándose cada vez más, ya que sabe que el conocimiento es muy importante.
Ella está haciendo el masterado en Derecho Penal y Criminología que le permitirá ejercer la profesión de docente especializada, más, la posibilidad de ayudar a otros profesionales como tutor en la rama elegida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su curso y así seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Maria is a lawyer from the city of Pilar. She is a woman with great aspirations who wants to continue growing and studying. Even though she is already a professional, Maria wants to continue educating and enlightening herself since knowledge is very important. She is studying for a Masters Degree in Criminal Law and Criminology so that she can begin practicing this specialty. In addition, she will be able to help other professionals as an expert in this particular field.

Maria is requesting this loan in order to invest in the payment of her course fees so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her Masters Degree.

loans.name: Tekoporave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tekoporave rekavo está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, en este grupo integran mujeres  indígenas trabajadoras  donde todas se ayudan por salir adelante. Todas viven en la colonia Nueva Esperanza, una zona alejada de la parte céntrica, bastante rural y de difícil acceso.
Todas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, ya que es lo único que pueden hacer por ser de un lugar muy apartado, ellas están muy agradecidas por esta oportunidad que les dio la fundación, ya que no cualquiera apostaría por ellas. 
Loida solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en comprar balanceados para sus animales, y que de esa forma no le falte este producto tan importante.
texts.en:
The group called “Tekoporave Rekavo” is in its first loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. This group includes hardworking indigenous women who are helping one another move forward. All of them live in the neighborhood of Nueva Esperanza, which is located in a central rural region that is difficult to access.

The members engage in raising and selling farm animals since that is the only type of business that can be conducted in such a remote place. They are very grateful for this opportunity that has been provided by Fundación Paraguaya since no one else is willing to take a chance on them.

Loida is requesting a loan so that she can invest in balanced feed for her animals. By taking out a loan, she will no longer be lacking in essential supplies.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en: Restituta is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of five children. Restituta has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. Restituta dreams of making her farming venture a success and stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Utamaduni . Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa, who is in her late forties, is married with six children. All of her children are grown up. For five years now, Mtumwa has had two enterprises: a mama lishe business (local restaurant) and a new clothes business selling door to door. She runs each of her businesses for four hours only (06am to 02pm). In this time, Mtumwa is able to earn a fair profit per month. 

This will be her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more clothes and food cooking items. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she managed to increase all her business stock. The business profit was used to put light in her own room and covered home expenses. Mtumwa dreams that one day she will able to own a hotel. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Utamaduni" which consists of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and food cooking items.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. She has been doing embroidery work since 2008 to cover her family's needs.
She is talented in her domain and recommended by most of her customers. But, since she is a Palestinian refugee, she is living and working in a Palestinian camp with no access to different areas of work.
Her income combined with her husband's aren't enough to cover their family's needs, that's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to start an additional business. She will start selling shoes and hopes to develop the business in the future.
She hopes to develop both businesses and expand her working zone.

loans.use: to start a new business to increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to run her business.

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en:
This is Fannie, 43, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a maintenance worker and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Fannie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Fannie hopes to expand her business and have other sources of income. She dreams of giving her children a good quality education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 24 years old and single. He lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Ali is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. Ali opened his general store 7 months ago. Now he needs a loan of 900 AZN to buy watches, candles and other goods for his business. In the future, Ali wants to repair his store. This will be more profitable for his business. Ali wants to get married and have a family with 2 children. Ali is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy watches, candles and other goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in his business.

loans.name: Mamed

texts.en:
Mamed lives with his family, his wife and daughter. At a young age, he began working at a reinforced concrete shop. Since then, he has found this line of work to be interesting and very productive. In addition, he likes the idea of being his own boss. He works with four assistants every day in his own workshop. 

Mamed works hard for his family's happiness. He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, VFAC for the dowry for his daughter, since he can't afford taking this amount directly from his business capital.
