He hopes to keep on responding to his family's needs and expanding his business.

loans.use: To get a dowry for his daughter.

loans.name: Las Compañeras Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa mujer de 62 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo de 25 años. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos, comida y nacatamales desde hace 35 años, su nuera le ayuda con la elaboración de sus productos. Tiene 5 años de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo solicita para comprar materia prima como azúcar, arroz, aceite, frutas como granadilla, papaya, melón, guayaba, carne de res, carne de pollo, carne de cerdo, etc. Karen mujer de 31 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosmético de Avon y Maryury mujer de 27 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Rosa, a 62 year old woman with a 25 year old son. Her business has been selling beverages, food and nacatamales for 35 years. Her daughter in law helps her make her products. She has been with the institution for 5 years. The loan she is asking for is to buy raw materials such as sugar, rice, oil, and fruit such as granadilla, papaya, melon, and guayaba, as well as beef, chicken, pork, etc. Karen is a 31 year old woman. Her business is selling Avon cosmetics. Maryury is 27 years old, and her business is selling used clothing.

loans.use: to invest in buying raw materials such as sugar, rice, oil, and fruit such as granadilla, papaya, melon, and guayaba, as well as beef, chicken, pork, etc.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora de 28 años de edad, acompañada, con un hijo de 4 años. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de calzados de sandalia desde hace 5 años. Sus productos los entrega por encargo a dos costarricense, tiene 4 trabajadores particulares que elaboran el calzado. El crédito lo requiere para invertir en comprar materiales como cartón, suelas, pega.
texts.en:
María, 28, is an enterprising woman.  She's married and has a child, 4.

María's business for the past five years has been making and selling sandals.  She assigns her products to two Costa Rican workers.  She has four employees who make the footwear.

She needs the loan to invest in buying materials such as cardboard, soles, and glue.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, soles, and glue

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Хусния родилась в городе Канибадам Согдийской области.Она  имеет 3-детей.   Хусния очень трудолюбивый человек,  занимается откормом крупно-рогатого скота и продает домашние собственноручные молочные продукты на рынке.  Этой своей деятельностью она кормит свою семью и ее доход является основной в ее семье. С целью улучшения своей доходности Хусния собирается увеличить количество своих коров и тем самым расширить свою домашнюю продукцию.  По совету знакомых Хусния решила подать заявку на кредит и обратилась в организацию Арванд. Очень надеется,что с помощью Аранд Хусния сможет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свои условия проживания.  Заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Husniya was born in the city of Kanibadam in the Sogdian Oblast.  She has three children and she is a very hard-working person.  Husniya raises livestock and sells their dairy products, which she herself makes by hand, at the market.  This is the way she earns a living for her family and she is the main breadwinner at home.  With the goal of increasing her income, Husniya plans to increase her head of cattle and thus expand her range of dairy products.  Following the advice of a friend, Husniya decided to apply for a loan and turned to Arvand.  She hopes that with the help of Arvand, she can expand her business and improve her living conditions.  She extends her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en: Zhana is 48 years old from the seaside city of Batumi. She is married and lives with her spouse in their own house. The only source of income for the couple is the small monthly rent from the commercial space located in crowded street of Batumi. Unfortunately, the existing income is not enough to make ends meet for them. So, Zhana decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Zhana’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn't satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This Start-up Program gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $2500 USD, she will purchase secondhand clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community. She will set up a store and offer her customers a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children.  Zhana is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased due to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing for resale

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Chreb is aged 34 years and married with five children, three of whom are still in school. For the last five years, she has been farming rice on three-hectares of farmland to support her family. To supplement the household income, her husband also works for others for a fee. With the current business, Chreb can earn about KHR 48,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.
This is Chreb's first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chreb is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the income for her family so as to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Demba Saido

texts.fr: Monsieur Demba est un homme qui habite dans les environs du Guichet. Il est célibataire et n'a pas d'enfants. Il a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter du ciment et construire sa propre maison. A l'avenir il souhaite investir dans le secteur du transport. Demba commence sa journée à 8 pour la terminer à 18h.
texts.en:
Mr. Demba is a man who lives near the branch office. He is single and has no children. 

He needs this loan to buy cement and build his own house. In the future he wants to invest in the transportation sector.
Demba starts his day at 8 am to finish at 6 pm.

loans.use: Buy cement to build his own house

loans.name: Debora

texts.es:
Debora es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven en su casa de habitación ya que son menores de edad. Con 2 años de educación primaria ella lucha diariamente en compañía de su compañero de hogar para que sus hijos no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud paso apoyándoles en todo lo que puede y lo necesario para que a ellos no les falte nada. Ella se dedica especialmente al cultivo de café desde muy joven teniendo mucha experiencia en el cultivo de este y otros productos como el maíz y los frijoles. La tierra que en compañía de su pareja de hogar trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo físico y algunas restricciones por muchos años para obtener un terreno de forma propia y evitar pagar alquiler de tierras para sacar adelante su familia la cual está ubicada en la misma propiedad donde ella y su familia habitan siendo ellos 2 los únicos que se involucran es las diferentes actividades del campo.

Sus metas y sueños son las de darle a sus hijos una buena educación un buen futuro con el cual ellos puedan tener como la mejor arma para el día de mañana. Es por ello que ella lucha día a día y hoy ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra insumos agrícolas como: formula cafetalera, formula de crecimiento, formula 18-46-0 y urea que ayudara a darles un excelente y satisfactorio mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que los ingresos para su familia dependen de esta actividad.
texts.en: Debora is a farmer and a housewife. She has two children, who are still underage and thus live with her. She has only two years of primary school, but she fights every day, side-by-side with her partner, in order to give her children a better life than hers. She aims to support them in all she cans so that they want for nothing. Debora's speciality is coffee crops, having been a farmer for many years. She is very experienced with many crops, among them coffee, sweetcorn, and broad beans. The land the couple tills belongs to them, and was bought by the sweat of their brow, after saving and making sacrifices for many years. They wanted to own the land, as renting it would have offered next to no hope of carving out a better life for their family. Their house is located on this property, since they are the only ones who work at the farm. Debora's dream is her goal of giving her children a good education, which she thinks of as the key to a better future and to success in life. She fights day after day for this goal and thus asked field partner COMIXMUL for a loan in order to buy coffee-plant fertiliser, coffee-plant growing mixture, 18-46-0 fertiliser, and urea, which will enable her to tend to her coffee crops and profit from the expected plentiful harvest, since her business is her family's only source of income.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 44-year-old married mother of five children. She has been selling clothes since 2007. Her business is going just fine, but she needs additional financial support to make sure that it will develop properly.

Tamam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise by buying a new clothing collection for this coming season. She and her husband run the same business, which is why they have to develop it properly to make sure that their one income source is enough to cover their family's needs and sudden requests.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise by buying a new clothes collection.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of eight children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members such as her grandchildren. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  

Mary generates additional income through selling tomatoes and onions. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include her children's school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 22-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is a mother of a 2-year-old baby boy. She operates a fish-vending business. She sells fish to earn a living. She has been selling fish for nearly two years now. Due to the demand of customers but a lack of financial capability to sustain her livelihood, Evelyn has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy various fresh fish to resell in order to augment her income. Evelyn would like to expand her fish-vending business to support her growing child and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Agshin

texts.en:
Agshin's income depends entirely on what he produces on his farm. As a result, he's always looking for ways to reduce costs in order to take home more money. Agshin owns a sheep farm in his village. He would like to buy more animals and add water fountains. These improvements need a lot of capital. 
Agshin is married and is a father of two little children, ages 2 and 5. The reason he has applied for a loan is to make repairs on his home and improve his family's living conditions. This will make his wife happy. He needs 500 AZN to buy limestone and cement.

loans.use: To purchase limestone and cement to start repairs on his home.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman and mother of five children who are all grown-ups and not in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her major monthly expense is medication.

Mwanasiti prepares food in a cafe and sells it to her customers. Her greatest business challenge is seasonality.

She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase beans, sugar, tea leaves, rice and wheat flour for resale. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, tea leaves, rice and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 45 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh est un groupement d’intérêt  économique qui est née depuis 2003.Il regroupe actuellement plus de 3000 membres  composés dans  sa majorité  de femmes et d’hommes  localisées dans les différentes  régions du Sénégal. La création de ce GIE a pour objet de permettre a ses membres d’exercer des activités de production agricoles et halieutiques, de commerce  général import export, de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiment, d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de transport pèche, d’exploitation des hydrocarbures, d’art, de culture, d’imprimerie, de services de menuiserie bois, d’actions d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture, de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace, de boulangerie et de prestation  de service. Il est représenté au niveau national par madame Ramatoulaye Faye qui a signé un protocole d’accord avec UIMCEC dans le cadre de financement de ses membres ce qui leur permettrait d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités. Par conséquent Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 45 est un sous groupe de crédit  du GIE qui est composé de 10 femmes représentées par la dame Fatou  (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo). Elles travaillent ensemble dans la même zone. Fatou  est une femme  mariée qui  s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce,  elle  pratique  la vente de produits alimentaires. Elle démarre chaque jour ses activités à 9heures du matin pour la terminer a 19 heures le soir. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de boites de conserve destinées a la vente. Elle souhaite développer davantage son activité de commerce. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent d’épargner de l’argent  dans le but de réaliser dans le futur son projet d’acquisition d’une cantine. Elle souhaite aussi avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh is an economic interest group (EIG)  that was created in 2003. It currently counts more than 3,000 members composed for the most part of men and women located in different regions of Senegal.

The purpose of this EIG is to allow its members to engage in various activities: agricultural and fisheries production, general trade imports and exports, transportation, industry, crafts, building industry, livestock breeding, mining, transportation for the fishing industry, exploitation of hydrocarbons, art, culture, printing, carpentry services, public service activities, representation, processing of fishery products, agriculture, sale of spare parts, ice-making, bakery and delivery services.

The group is represented nationally by Mrs. Ramatoulaye Faye who has signed an agreement with UIMCEC regarding funding for its members which would allow them to acquire material and financial resources to further develop their activities.

Consequently Makarimal Akhlakh group 45 is a GIE credit subgroup, composed of 10 women represented by lady Fatou (the one with the raised hand on the photo). They all work in the same area of activity.

Fatou is a married woman who has been active for more than 10 years in retail commerce, selling food products. She starts each day's activities at 9 am in the morning to finish at 7 pm. She is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC where she is requesting a loan to purchase canned goods destined for sale. 

She wants to further develop her trade activity. The income provided enables her to save money to eventually acquire a canteen. With the increased profits she also wants to contribute towards improving her family's nutritional well-being.

loans.use: buy canned goods for retail sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, etc. for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE AMIGAS” iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celestina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejedora de bitles, costura de enaguas, flete de joyas, venta de manzanas, venta de productos, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de chinelas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celestina es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte y seis ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que quería formar un grupo en Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió desde su juventud siendo mas de 30 años que lo trabaja.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal association “SIEMPRE AMIGAS” will begin its twenty-sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is a group that is comprised of eight members and is led by a board of directors in which Ms. Celestina is the Secretary. The members of this communal association run various businesses, some of which are: weaving turtlenecks, sewing traditional skirts, making jewellery, selling apples, selling products, selling vegetables, selling fruit, and selling sandals.

The loan will be beneficial to small microbusinesses of which Celestina is a member. She states that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for twenty-six cycles by the invitation of a friend who wanted to create a Pro Mujer group. Today she has a business in which she sells vegetables, something that she learned to do in her youth and has been working at it for more than 30 years.

The loan for which she is now applying will be used to increase capital (to buy vegetables) that she will purchase from sellers in the city of El Alto, and will then sell in her sales space. This line of work allows her to generate resources for her family since she is divorced and has four children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the health area.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Juana Socorrro

texts.es:
Juana tiene 39 años de edad, vive al lado de su pareja con quien 4 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo y son su razón de vivir. Juana trabaja muy duro cada dia para poder sacar adelante a su familia, es por ello que desde muy temprano en la mañana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de palomitas de maíz, dulces y confites, con cuyos ingresos apoya a su pareja para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar. Juana cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Juana esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le estan brindando podrá comprar insumos para elaborar sus dulces como maíz poc corm, mani, papas, chancaca (dulce peruano parecido a la azúcar), entre otros, asi mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en: 39-year-old Juana lives with her partner and their 4 beloved children, who are her reason for living.  She works tremendously hard each day to support her family, working from the very early hours in her little shop where she sells popcorn, sweets and confectionery.  Her income from this enables her to help her partner in covering the household expenses.  Juana believes that she is succeeding because she is friendly towards her customers.  She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their help, she will be able to buy supplies for making her sweets, such as popcorn, peanuts, potatoes and chancaca (a Peruvian sweet similar to sugar), among other things.  This will mean that she can boost her income and carry on working to achieve her greatest ambition:  "to allow her children to have a career".

loans.use: to buy supplies such as potatoes, corn and peanuts, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a space and to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Albertina

texts.es:
Maria tiene 25 años de edad, vive al lado de su pareja, quien la apoya en todo lo que ella emprende y es su mano derecha, Maria con mucho esfuerzo cada día trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad y con el fruto de su humilde trabajo solventa los gastos del hogar, Maria cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque quiere mejorar cada día.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para tarrajear y refaccionar las paredes de su humilde vivienda, ya que actualmente presenta varias grietas, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Terminar de construir u vivienda”.
texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old. She lives with her spouse, who helps her with everything she does and is her right hand. Maria works very hard every day as a laborer at a farm in her area. With the fruit of her humble labor she pays for the household expenses. Maria thinks that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and above all, because she wants to improve day to day. 

Maria is very grateful with the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy construction materials so she can plaster and fix the walls in her humble home. Right now, there are several cracks. This way, she can improve her quality of life. She will keep fighting to make her biggest dream come true: finishing construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma, es una mujer de 39 años de edad, su compañero de vida trabaja como jornalero en un corral ordeñando vacas a dos turnos diarios, sus dos hijos viven con ellos el mayor de 19 años trabaja como jornal junto con su papá; ya que al terminar los estudios de educación básica y por el distanciamiento de los institutos le fue muy difícil seguir estudiando, tendría que viajar todos los días a la ciudad y el transporte es irregular solo sale un autobús de ese lugar y su hija menor estudia en la escuela de la comunidad el cuarto grado en la escuela que esta a  dos cuadras de sus casa.

La cliente trabaja actualmente cuidando una anciana en la ciudad, una noche de por medio de 5 p.m a 6 a.m  por varios años a trabajado de esa manera o en oficios domésticos en la ciudad; teniendo que viajar unos 10 km y el transporte es irregular, solo un autobús pasa por esa comunidad y si no salen a tiempo deberán viajar en “pick up”. 

 Anteriormente, trabajaba en su casa en pequeñas actividades de comercio con su mamá, ellas elaboraban tamales de gallina para vender en su comunidad, trabajaban la agricultura y cuidando animales domésticos de patio(cerdos gallinas y ganado bovino). Y cuando los gastos en su familia fueron mas, ella tubo que buscar otros ingresos y por referencias familiares y amistades consiguió trabajo como empleada domestica en la ciudad.     


Con el préstamo Norma, comprara mas materiales de construcción, para empezar la construcción de su casa. ya que con un primer préstamo que se le dio compro los ladrillos para las paredes; ya que actualmente viven en una casa de su mamá; pero ya quieren empezar a construir su propia casa en un terreno que le heredo su mamá.    

 La meta es algún día terminar su casa para vivir mas cómodamente y tener algunos animales de patio sin causar perjuicio a nadie y que sus hijos puedan estar mas cómodos, en un lugar mas amplio y mas seguro y que la hija, si ella quiere la apoyaran para que estudie educación media. Luego, de que termine el nivel básico en la comunidad.

 La idea es ir saliendo poco a poco con lo que trabaja su compañero de vida y su hijo se cubren las gastos de la familia y con los ingresos de su trabajo pagan las cuotas del préstamo y si es necesario se saca otro para terminar la construcción.
texts.en:
Norma is 39 years old. Her life partner works as a day labourer at a farm, milking cows twice a day. Their two children live with them and their son who is 19 works with his father as a day labourer. When he finished his basic education it was very difficult for him to carry on studying because the secondary schools are a long way away. He would have to travel to the city every day and the transport is irregular, with only one bus a day from the place where they live. Their younger daughter is studying in fourth grade at the community school which is 2 blocks from their house.

Norma's current work is looking after an elderly lady in the city every other night from 5pm to 6am. She has been doing this type of work or working as a domestic help in the city for several years. She has to travel 10km to work and the transport is irregular with only one bus a day passing through the community and if they are not on time they have to travel by "pick-up".

Previously Norma worked at home on small business activities with her mum. They used to make chicken tamales to sell in their community and also worked in agriculture and looking after farm animals (pigs, chickens and cattle) at their home. When the family's expenses became greater, Norma had to look for other forms of income and through references from friends and family she was able to find work as a domestic help in the city.

Norma will use the loan to buy building materials to begin building her house, since the family are currently living in a house of her mother's. She used a first loan she was given to buy bricks for the walls, but now they want to start building their own house on a piece of land which her mother left her.

The aim is to finish the house one day so they can live more comfortably and to have farmyard animals without affecting anyone else. She wants her children to be more comfortable in a bigger and more secure place, and will support her daughter if wants to continue to intermediate school once she finishes her basic education in the community. The idea is to keep making progress bit by bit. The money which her life partner and her son earn covers the family's living expenses and the income Norma gets pays for the loan instalments. If necessary she will take out another loan to finish building the house.

loans.use: to buy building materials, to start building her house.

loans.name: Bella Vista Pucarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BELLA VISTA PUCARANI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eulalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, trenzado de mantas, tejido de mantas, venta de queso, venta de helado, venta de cerveza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eulalia es integrante, ella indica es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás invirtiendo en el mismo un pequeño capital que tenía y vendiendo en las trancas de viaje.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, arroz y aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “BELLA VISTA PUCARANI”  communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Copacabana center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Eulalia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling food, weaving blankets, selling cheese, selling ice cream and selling beer. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Eulalia. She says that this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her house. Right now, she has a business selling food. She says that she learned this business several years ago, investing a small amount of capital that she had in it and selling at the roadside. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital, buying pasta, rice and oil. She will acquire them in the nearby markets and later prepare and sell the food at her sales spot. This work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible. She is married and has seven children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy pasta, rice and oil.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
This is Jasmine. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed products for her mini grocery. Her income from her business assisted her in sending her child to school and also in their everyday expenses. She has been in this business for seven years now. She is already a widow, and that's why she is working so hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jasmine dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married and has four children. Three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, feeding the family and school fees.

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years. She generates additional income through selling soft drinks. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to build her own house.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales  of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 44 years old and married. she has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Yolanda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to  buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Hermes Alfonso

texts.es:
Hermes es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, el es un persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzos pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación que deseaba.
por iniciativa propia, Hermes trabaja como albañil, el realiza construcciones, mejoramiento de viviendas y otros, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo y dedicación.
Hermes se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción como madera, las cuales utilizara como herramienta para sus construcciones, así pues Hermes seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Hermes is a man of 28, single, and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and brothers. He is friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic. He puts all of his efforts into getting ahead. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to study a technical degree in computers, something that he wished for. Through his own initiative, Hermes works as a carpenter. He does construction, making improvements on homes. He works every day for about 12 hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his effort and dedication. 

Hermes is thankful for the Kiva loans, because due to the support provided, he will be able to purchase construction material such as wood, which he will use as a tool for his construction. This way Hermes will continue working and making an effort to achieve his big dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Soso

texts.en:
Soso, 46, is married and lives with wife and two school-age children in the village of Nikortsminda. 

Soso is a builder and works on special orders locally. Besides, he has a small scale agricultural business and grows nuts and apples in his garden. The harvested products are sold locally. Still, the existing income is not enough to cover everyday expenses. 

Soso is a very enthusiastic man and wants to generate more income and help the family. Soso decided to start a grocery store, but he found that he didn't have enough money to do so. Unfortunately, Soso was unable to obtain a loan from existing financial institutions, as they required a stable income and business experience as a precondition to a loan. But Soso has now received his loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-start-up loans with easy terms to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit. 

With a loan of 1,000 GEL (Georgian Lari) Soso will purchase basic groceries and start up a store. He will care for his clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this determination and his loan he expects to improve his income and give his family members better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries for resale.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 35 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elvie has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Elvie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, three of whom are in school, Ada works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Ada is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell, like tomatoes, garlic, onions, eggplant, etc.

Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell, like tomatoes, garlic, onions, eggplant, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items like, onions, oil, sugar, beans and tomatoes.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a single mother of four children. Three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity but has piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has business of selling sugar canes and Cavendish bananas and has been in this business for six years. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income through selling mobile phone airtime. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar canes and Cavendish bananas.

loans.use: To buy more sugar canes and cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas continua con la venta de productos secos como maíz, cebada, trigo y otros productos, ella continua llevando a vender productos secos a la ciudad de Pilcopata y cuando regresa trae fruta como plátanos, naranjas, piñas, cocona, carambola, coca, achote y otros. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas y poder incrementar su capital de negocio.  

Felicitas nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 36 años y es padre y madre para sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues selling dried goods like corn, barley, wheat and other products. She continues to take the dried goods to Pilcopata to sell and returns with fruit such as bananas, oranges, pineapples, cocona fruit, starfruit, coca leaves, annatto and other items. 

On this occasion she requires a loan to buy more fruit to increase her business capital. 

Felicitas was born in the community of Jajahuana and continues to live there. (The community of Jajahuana is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco, Peru). She is 36 years old and must be both mother and father to her three children.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Imarika Group

texts.en:
ATHMA, who is in her early 20s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been running a genge-duka (selling fruits and vegetables in the same shop). She also sells sugar, salt, beans, wheat flour, baking flour and cooking oil.

This will be ATHMA's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restock on the items missing at her business, and she is doing very fine. She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to buy a bed and a mattress, and to pay school fees and household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy more fruit, vegetables, sugar, salt, beans, wheat flour, baking flour and cooking oil. Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business into a grocery.

ATHMA will share this loan with her loan group "IMARIKA" with eleven members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, vegetables, sugar, salt, beans, wheat flour, baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Ella tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos. Sus actividad económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ella en sus tierras de cultivo siembre maíz, papa, cebada, trigo, tarwi, habas y otros para luego verndelas en diferentes mercados. Ella también se dedica al engorde de ganado. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en: Brigida, 41, is married and has five children who are the fruit of this beautiful relationship. She works in agriculture and raising small farm animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She grows corn, potato, barley, wheat, tarwi [a species of lupin grown in the Andes] and beans, among other things, and sells them in different marketplaces. She also raises livestock. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Due to insufficient income, Erlinda engages in cooking and selling snacks in the community to generate additional income. She is 44 years old and has three school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income to provide the financial needs of her children in school. 

In this regard, she plans to cook and sell different kinds of snacks to increase her income. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to buy malagkit (powdered rice), cooking oil, sugar, wrappers, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the local community. She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business and hopes that she will make it more profitable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy malagkit (powdered rice), cooking oil, sugar, wrappers, vegetables and seasonings.

loans.name: Endalicia

texts.en:
Endalicia is 50 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Endalicia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, vinegar, bread, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 8 years. Endalicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, vinegar, bread, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Pablita is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Pablita has been buying and selling livestock for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Victoria helps her husband in cultivating their farm.

Victoria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus increasing their yield and profit. In the future, Victoria has hopes of making the farming venture a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Malta

texts.en:
Malta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 27,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional tools and equipment for her business.

Malta has been in this business for two years. Malta earns more income from pig fattening.

Malta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children who are in school, Angela works hard to support her family.

She has an ambulant vending of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets and farming rice. Angela is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her ambulant vending of dried fish business.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
This is Annalisa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her income from her business assisted her in sending her child to school and also in their everyday expenses. She also has a vending karaoke machine and she also sells rice. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Annalisa dreams that her business will last a long time and hopes to have a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 that meet weekly. The groups study the Word of God, build social capital, and encourage the repayment of micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Al Malaika Group

texts.en:
Thanaa is the featured borrower of Al Malaika group. She joined her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Thanaa is a 40-year-old married mother of two children and responsible for her family's living. She is employed in a furniture showroom where she receives a low income. She hopes that one day she can start her own business. The applied-for loan will be invested in paying her children's school tuition fees.

In the picture, Thanaa is the one wearing brown in the middle. As for the other group members, Marleine is the one at the left and Chris is the one at the right.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen, aged 26, is married with a young child. She lives with her spouse and child in Bakan district of Pursat province. Her husband owns a taxi and has a service-based business providing transportation back and forth from Phnom Penh to Pursat while she manages farming business to earn a living. Chen occasionally accompanies her husband to be his assistant because she thinks that she might help him to catch customers at taxi stands. 

She currently needs a loan to help her build a bathroom and buy plumbing fixtures because there is no bathroom in her house. This loan will improve her family’s quality of life, and make her living more comfortable by keeping the environment clean and freer of disease. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and buy fixtures for it.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
This is Benedicta. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the needed fertilizers and materials for her business. Her income from her business helped her family in sustaining their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a new 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers and other materials needed for her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benedicta dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will all be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like beans, tomatoes, onions and many other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.en:
Maria Belen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "buying and selling frozen products" business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell for her frozen products business.

Maria Belen has been in this business for 20 years. Maria Belen earns more income from poultry.

Maria Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Dante

texts.es:
Dante es soltero, vive en alquiler en la ciudad de La Paz. Es chef profesional y trabaja de manera independiente dando servicios gastronómicos. Dante es un profesional reciente, por lo que no es muy conocido y le cuesta mucho conseguir trabajos eventuales. Requiere el crédito para la compra de otro horno para incrementar su produccion culinaria y ser apto para atender órdenes grandes de clientes exigentes que requieran un servicio de urgencia (que es lo que sucede cuando alguien previamente a contratado a una persona que acaba fallándole, por lo que debe apurarse en encontrar un reemplazo). Además, una inversión como esta permite a Dante no afectar la salud de sus clientes vendiendo comida en buen estado y siendo preparada con menos gasto de energía. 

El sueño de Dante es crecer profesionalmente y en el futuro encontrar mejores opciones de vivienda donde no tenga que pagar alquileres.
texts.en:
Dante is single and lives in a rented home in La Paz.  He is a professional chef and works on his own, providing food service.  He is a new professional and he has trouble finding jobs because he is not yet well known.  He needs this loan so he can buy another oven to increase his production and be able to fill large orders for customers who need his services quickly (which happens when a customer has hired another person who has not delivered, and who must work quickly to find a replacement.)  Besides, an investment like this one will allow Dante to preserve his customer’s health, by selling food prepared cleanly and will less energy.

Dante’s dream is to grow professionally and find better options for life in the future, where he won’t have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Señor De San Bartolome Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEÑOR DE SAN BARTOLOME”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucy es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, comercio de detergentes, venta de condimentos, venta de refrescos, servicio de transporte, ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucy es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta; este negocio lo emprendió con el primer préstamo que obtuvo en Pro Mujer y desde esa fecha  lo trabaja con su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “SEÑOR DE SAN BARTOLOME” is beginning its fourth cycle with the field partner through the field partner’s Villa Tejada regional office. This group is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Lucy is the secretary. The businesses of the members are varied and include selling salchipapas [a fast food consisting of thinly sliced pan-fried beef sausages and French fries], selling detergents, selling condiments and seasonings, selling soft drinks, providing transportation services, and a hardware store.

The loan will be used in some small businesses of which Lucy is a member. Lucy says that she joined the field partner ten years ago at the invitation of a friend that is a member. Lucy currently has a business selling fruit. She started this business with her first loan from the field partner, and since then she has worked at this business with her family.

Lucy will use this loan to increase the capital of her business by buying more fruit. She will buy the fruit in the markets of the city of El Alto and then sell it from her sales stall. She says that her business allows her to earn income to pay for as many of her household expenses as possible. Lucy is married and has three children.

Asked what she likes about the field partner, Lucy says that she likes the training programs that deal with credit and with health.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business   of selling non-alcoholic drinks and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of mineral water, boxes of packed juice, oranges and mangoes, and sugar for making juice. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. 

Lydia works in a shop, seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also being able to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mineral water, boxes of packed fruit juice, oranges and mangoes and sugar for making juice.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is a 63-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish to earn a livelihood. She has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like nylon, ropes and crab net to augment her income. In the future, Felisa would like to set aside some of the profits to provide a healthy diet and good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nylon, ropes and crab net.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. 

Rosalinda runs a sari-sari or variety store business for a living. She has been engaged in the business for more than six years now. 

Rosalinda is asking for a loan to buy more groceries like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries for her shop and fertilizer for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve her store as well as the productivity of her farm.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes to make her ventures a success.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries for her shop and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
This is Rodita. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used buy more dressed chicken. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rodita hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of a peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of dressed chickens needed in her business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, attending school. He is the main income source of the family. He has owned a café since 2011. He provides his customers with delicious coffee and other hot drinks, fruits and “Narguileh”, a traditional Lebanese waterpipe or hookah. 

With his loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will increase his shop’s inventory of coffee, tea, milk and tobacco so that he can serve more customers and therefore earn higher income. This is his first Kiva loan, and Hussein is very excited to receive it as he is sure that it will impact positively on his business.

loans.use: increase his shop’s inventory of coffee, tea, milk and tobacco

loans.name: Armelyn

texts.en:
Armelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Armelyn dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: José Benjamín

texts.es:
José, es un hombre de 22 años de edad, se creció con sus padres, su mamá se dedicada a realizar los oficios domésticos y su papá trabaja como maestro de obra en construcciones, labores agrícolas y lecheria.  Fue así, como José aprendió el  oficio de albañilería y procesamiento de leche especializándose en la elaboración de quesillo, también tiene un poco de experiencia en lo que es el engorde de ganado bovino. 

Por lo general el cliente trabaja dentro de la comunidad y los alrededores de 7 a.m a 4 p.m.  Hace unos 7 años cuando realizaba un trabajo de albañilería con su papá, conoció a la que ahora es su compañera de vida  y se acompaño con ella y se cambio de domicilio, su compañera de vida solo hace los oficios domésticos de su hogar, ellos han procreado una niña de un año 8 meses de edad.

El cliente estudio solo educación básica luego que se acompaño;ya no pudo seguir la escuela y actualmente trabaja de manera independiente como albañil.       

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de ganado bovino de repasto ;ya que cuenta con un terreno que le han alquilado para pastar ganado cerca de la casa donde vive y le puede resultar un trabajo que a corto plazo que le genere algunos ingresos adicionales para él y su familia, Eso si, manifiesta que trabajara un poco mas y levantarse mas temprano para ir a dejar el ganado al potrero y luego marcharse a trabajar y en la tarde traer  al corral al ganado y darle agua . Actualmente solo tiene una ternera y paga lo mismo por el arrendamiento del terreno.

Con el préstamo, espera tener una oportunidad de trabajo extra que le genere ganancias a corto plazo; ya que su objetivo  es hacerse de una  casa debido a que vive en casa de su suegra. desde que se acompaño, pero quiere ir independizándose, desea que su hija crezca en un hogar propio y que cuando tenga la edad estudie.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old and grew up with his parents. His mum worked as a domestic help and his dad works as a construction foreman, in agricultural work and as a dairyman. This is how José learnt bricklaying and milk processing,  specialising in "quesillo" [soft cheese]. He also has a little experience in fattening cattle.

In general José works in his community and its outskirts, from 7am until 4pm. When he was working as a bricklayer with his dad 7 years ago, he met the girl who is now his life partner and he moved out of his home to live with her. His partner just does housework in her own house and they have an 8-month old baby girl.

José only studied basic education before he met his partner and after that he was not able to carry on with his schooling. He now works independently as a bricklayer.

The requested loan is to buy grazing cattle, since José already has a piece of land which he is renting for grazing cattle near to the house he lives in. This  may become something which gives him some additional income for himself and his family in the short term. For this he says he will work a bit harder and get up earlier to take the cattle to the pasture before going to work, bringing them back to the pen in the afternoon and giving them water. At the moment he only has one heifer and he pays the same amount for renting the land.

He hopes to use the loan to provide an extra work opportunity which will give him profits in the short term. His aim is to get himself a house because he has been living with his mother-in-law since meeting his partner and he wants to become independent. He wants his daughter to grow up in a home of her own and go to school when she is old enough.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 22 years old. He is single and lives in the Senaki district with his parents and a brother, who works at the local electricity company earning a small monthly income. His father runs a small-scale agricultural business. 

Nugzar has graduated from the local public school and was unable to get a higher education due to the financial difficulties. He is unemployed at the moment and wishes to start an animal-breeding business. In particular, he will purchase rabbits with the received startup loan and place them in the shed located in his yard. After propagation, Nugzar will sell the rabbits for a good price and increase the family income.

He is a very hardworking person, and he wishes to provide his family members with better living conditions.

Nugzar awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to start rabbit breeding.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah is a 30-year-old resident of Kyengera. She is a single mother with two children who both attend school and she also takes care of her brother’s son in all aspects.
 
Madinah deals in a business of selling Bitengi clothing. She started the business in 2010 with an aim of boosting her daily income and hence has good experience in the business. 

Madinah sells mostly to neighbors and people from different areas in the same arcade and other neighboring towns. Her challenges are inadequate capital, weather changes and competition.

Madinah requires more money for a loan to boost her business so that it obtains steady growth. She is hardworking and steady.

Madinah received a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more stock from towns to meet the high demand for the clothes by her customers.

loans.use: To buy bitengi clothing for sale.

loans.name: Kapampa Group

texts.en:
Siwa, who is in her mid 30s, is married and has four children who are in school. She is from Tujijenge, Tanzania.

For four years now, Siwa has been running a mamalishe business, offering wholesome street-food services. She is doing great in her project. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good return per month. 

This will be her third loan request, which she will use to buy more food-cooking items to offer more food services. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, she improved her business by buying more of the missing food-cooking items. Siwa used her profit to cover home expenses and school fees. She dreams that one day she will be able to own a hotel. 

Siwa will share this loan with her loan group,"Kapampa," which consists of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food-cooking items to offer more food services.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Las Flores De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario las flores de Sumpango, este frupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Carmen, de 33 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de tejidos tipicos para la venta se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años y le da gracias a Dios en gran manera ya que su negocio dia con dia a progresado y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito para la compra de tejidos tipicos para la venta, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: María Carmen is one member of the solidarity partnership “Las Flores de Sumpango” [The Flowers of Sumpango]. She is 33 years old, and she has worked selling traditional fabrics for four years now. She says that she is very thankful to God, because her business has been growing day by day. For this reason she is requesting this loan to buy traditional fabrics to offer for sale. She hopes that she will receive help through the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Unión De Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN DE AMIGAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: salón de belleza, pensión, tienda de abarrotes, venta de conservas, venta de licores, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de tucumanas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nora es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de libros; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió con un pequeño capital que tuvo y que decidió invertirlo en la compra de libros.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de libros) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
Unión de Américas Communal Bank will start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which Nora's the president.  The businesses of the bank members are varied and include a beauty salon, a restaurant, a grocery store, canned goods sales, liquor sales, appliance sales, and sales of "tucumanas" [regional-style turnovers].
 
Their loan will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Nora.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling books.  She says she learned the business with a small amount of capital she had and that she decided to invest in in buying books.

The loan she's going to get now is to increase her capital by buying books.  She'll get them from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later sell them in her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household to the extent possible, because she's married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the health area.

loans.use: to buy books

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma who is 45, she is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joselito, a mason and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gemma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Gemma dreams that her business will last long and hopes to improve her family's living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 53 years old, married and lives at the village of Amulung. He is an entrepreneur who sells grocery items to the people in his village. His wife is his partner in managing the business. He has been in his business for over four years now and earns about Php 4,000 each month. 

He aspires for higher income that is why he is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, bread and noodles to sell in his store.

Benjamin hopes to keep providing good products and services to all his customers leading to better income someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, bread and noodles to sell in his store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines. Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming business.

Analyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her rice farming business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 44-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working in clothes selling  for ten years. In 2010, she opened her own shop, where she sells clothes and lingerie at the same place.

Najwa is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop her lingerie sector with a new collection, which will surely increase her income and improve her shop. Her shop is located at the main road, which is a very good spot to attract new customers and expand her business.

Najwa hopes to keep on developing her business to keep on providing her family with their needs.

loans.use: To develop her lingerie sector with a new collection

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a laundry business  and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400 000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more brushes, bars of soap and liquid soap and an ironing board. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. 

Jane works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning washing machines to assist in washing and also building her own house and business premises. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy  more brushes, bars of soap and liquid soap and an ironing board.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 59 years old and married. To earn a living, Lilia is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for 5 years and usually earns about 2,500 PHP per piglet. Lilia wants to have more piglets to raise. In this regard, she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and some hog feeds. Lilia hopes to sustain the needs of her hogs as well as her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and some hog feeds

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 51 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emerita is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emerita has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig-raising and general store businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 46 years old, single and lives with his retired parents in the village of Norio. Zaza is unemployed at the moment. There is high unemployment rate in the region and Zaza was unable to find a suitable job.
The only source for the family is the retirement pension of Zaza’s parents, which is hardly enough for food and every day expenses. That is why he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Zaza applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved within the framework of their Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $3000 will help Zaza to purchase a second-hand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them in return for a service fee. Zaza is very enthusiastic and is a hard working person with a great desire to get ahead. This credit will be a great support for the family. Zaza is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To start a taxi business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 29-year-old Lebanese married man. His wife is jobless at this moment. As for him, he started his career five years ago. His job consists of installing satellites. He works on a freelance basis and he serves customers and is building a wide and loyal clientele. Today, Hasan is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase new tools and supplies needed such as wires, chains, cables, screwdriver etc… He states that these purchases will ease his business operations. Hasan’s only purpose is to earn a good income from his work as he plans to have babies soon and must provide for their needs.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and supplies

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. Now, he lives with his family in the Fuzuli region. Azad is 29 years old and he is single. 

Azad started his business of raising calves two years ago. Now he needs a loan of AZN 2,100 to buy calves to increase milk production. Azad sells cheese, curd, sour cream, and other milk products at the bazaar. 

In the future, Azad wants to have a big farm for his business. This will be more profitable for his business. Azad wants to get married and has a friendly family. He is thankful to Komak Credit Union and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase milk production.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Ella tiene 65 años de edad y es padre y madre para sus ocho hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ella tiene sus terrenos de cultivos donde siembre mayormente papa y ella lleva a vender la papa a la ciudad de Pilcopata y de regreso compra hoja de coca para luego venderlo en la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar hojas de coca.
