texts.en: María Manuela is 65 years old and both father and mother for her eight children. She belongs to the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana communal bank and says she is a responsible and entrepreneurial person. She works in agriculture, including raising cattle and small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also has fields where she grows mostly potatoes. She takes the potatoes to the city of Pilcopata to sell them, and on the way back, she buys coca leaves to later sell in the city of Cusco. She is requesting this loan to buy coca leaves.

loans.use: to buy coca leaves.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a fisherman from the town of CPG, Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of two children. Ruel has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income.

Ruel is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this loan, he will  be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

Ruel has hopes of improving his fishing business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 59 years old, married and has five children. 

Lucena is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lucena requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucena has been farming rice for 13 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Yeanoh. She is married, and has four children ages 22, 19, 16 and 12. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives.
 
In 2008, Yeanoh established her cookery business. She began her business because her husband’s income was not enough to support their family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. Yeanoh requires a loan to purchase more food stock for her business.

Yeanoh was able to acquire a piece of land and paid school fees for her children. 

In the future, Yeanoh plans to develop her newly acquired land and also continue to support her children's  educate up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, stock and salt

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with 3 children ages 4 , 7 and 10 years old. Two of her children are currently attending school. She began this business because she wants to be self dependent.

Fatmata runs a general stock business. She sells soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Fatmata says that sometime business is very difficult.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pure water, biscuits and sweets for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like beans, onions, and cooking oil among other items

loans.name: Kawral Gourel Serigne Group

texts.fr:
L e  groupe de crédit  Kawral Gourel Serigne regroupe deux femmes qui font de la vente de vêtements et chaussures pour enfants.
La  présidente madame NINI  exerce le commerce depuis 04 ans et son activité consiste à vendre des vêtements de prêt à porter pour enfants dans le marché local. NINI arrive à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Dans l’avenir elle voudra avoir son propre magasin et être autonome.
texts.en: The Kawral Gourel Serigne Group is made up of two women who are selling clothes and shoes for children. The president of the group is Nini, who has been running her business for the past four years. Her business consists of selling ready to wear clothing for children at the local market. Nini is able to support the daily needs of her family. She starts her work day at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. In the future she would like to have her own shop and become independent.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of five children. None of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any other family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX (Uganda shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, soap, rice and salt to sell. She generates additional income from rental houses. She works in the shop seven days of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop, to own a delivery van for transportation and to build more rental houses. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and feeding the family

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
This is Gertrudes. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the materials she needed and fertilizers for her farm. Her income from her business is helping her and her family with their everyday expenses. She is also a jeepney operator, and her husband is a Barangay Captain (elected member of local government). They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs. She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more planting materials and fertilizer for her farm. Her profits from this business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Gertrudes dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more planting materials and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Nenita

texts.en:
This is Maria Nenita. She previously took out a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy buy a larger and more varied supply of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenses. She would like to apply for another loan, of 20,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Maria Nenita dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: As a 37-year-old married woman, Christina works hard to support her family. She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, Christina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional pork to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. Christina has been sustaining her business activities with her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pork to sell.

loans.name: Sai Chon

texts.en:
Sai Chon has lived her whole life in Sugar Cane Creek Village (“Huay Oi” in Thai) in rural northern Thailand. Sai Chon and her family are Thai citizens, but as members of a small remote community they have suffered from marginalization and limited economic opportunity. 

Sai Chon’s life has had many ups and downs. For many years her husband was the village headman and she was active in the village as a “first lady.” Two years ago her husband fell ill and their world came tumbling down. Their business endeavors fell by the wayside and their finances became extremely precarious. There are few safety nets for families in their position- most loans come with exorbitant interest rates and end up with families trapped in a vicious cycle of poverty. 

Sai Chon trained as a weaver and found fulfillment through her hammock weaving work. She is able to secure a solid income for herself and her family and to leave the intense worry of the past few years behind. 

This loan will provide her family with the needed funds to get her hammock business off the ground and grow her income to a level of ongoing stability.

loans.use: to get her hammock business off the ground

loans.name: Lamduan

texts.en:
Lamduan was born in rural “Huay Oi” (Sugar Cane Creek) Village and spent her entire life living within that small, remote community. She and her family face the same troubles of many poor villagers- obstacles to employment, dependence on uncertain crop prices and a lack of formal education.

For most of her adult life, she was a farm laborer. Her chances to get ahead in life were limited to crop sales and her entire year’s income was completely dependent on price fluctuation.

As a woman, Lamduan also faced entrenched obstacles to her local political ambitions. While she was once very active in village leadership and served as the assistant to the village headman, she wasn’t able to rally the support to overcome the male-dominated hierarchy in her community. 

Weaving is an empowering opportunity for Lamduan and women like her. She is able to set her own schedule, work from home and earn an ample income without the risk and uncertainty of farm labor. She enjoys her weaving work and the power and independence it affords her. Weaving has helped improve women’s standing within the community, helping them earn greater respect from men and setting a strong example for their children. 

This loan will help Lamduan achieve greater financial independence and stability as she is able to plan her budget and production for the coming months.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her hammock business

loans.name: Wimon

texts.en:
Wimon was born and raised in northeastern Thailand (near the Cambodian border). Her village was so poor and the future so bleak that she took a big chance on moving away and finding factory work in Bangkok, the capital city.

In Bangkok she met her future husband, another transplant from the countryside. After their marriage, they moved to his ancestral home, the tiny village of “Huay Oi” in Phrae Province. He owned a small amount of land, so they entered into agrarian life. In recent years farming has required a larger and larger investment of money for seeds, chemicals and fertilizers. The family’s budget has been strained and it’s been a struggle to turn any profit off the land. 

Wimon found that hammock weaving was a perfect supplement to her income- she is able to work from her home in her spare time without missing out on family life. With her additional income, her family is able to make plans for the future. They are planning to build a house and put their daughter through school. 

This loan will allow her to invest more time in hammock weaving and greatly contribute to the family’s income.

loans.use: to invest in her hammock weaving and contribute to her family’s income.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is a weaver from Huay Oi (“Sugar Cane Creek”) Village in rural Northern Thailand. Although Kanika is a Thai citizen, she and her family and neighbors live in a poor, remote community and have faced many of the same troubles of hill tribe weavers- marginalization, limited education and limited opportunity. 

Kanika faces an additional obstacle due to her speech impediment. She fought hard to pursue education and learned to read and write. But her disadvantages made it nearly impossible for her to find gainful employment. Without her own land, she spent her life relying on others to hire her as a temporary farm hand and working in slash and burn fields using dangerous toxic chemicals.  

Weaving presented a perfect opportunity for Kanika to take control of her future and build the life she dreamed of. Now that she has trained as a weaver and found the work to her liking, she weaves hammocks full-time. She has found the independence and stability she craves. Ever the avid learner, Kanika was excited by the financial training she went through as part of the microloan program. With this loan she will be able to further secure her income and earning potential.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials so she can secure consistent hammock work

loans.name: Banyen

texts.en:
Banyen was born in rural “Huay Oi” (Sugar Cane Creek) Village. After growing up in the village, she took a risk on factory life in Bangkok, traveling hundreds of miles from her family and community. Although she found work in a shoe factory, she found city life too harsh and dangerous. Many rural people are faced with a similar quandary—while the city boasts economic opportunity, poor laborers are vulnerable to exploitation and live in dangerous conditions. 

Banyen returned to her village and turned to agricultural labor (along with her husband). They worked long hours using dangerous pesticides in an attempt to build a stable life, but could not achieve the security they longed for.  For Banyen and laborers like her, the biggest struggle can be financing- a typical personal loan requires collateral and exorbitant interest. 

The constant strain of farming led her to begin looking for a more reliable source of income. Banyen discovered the opportunity to weave hammocks and leapt at the chance to be trained and earn a supplementary income for her growing family. 

Her oldest daughter is enrolled at a government boarding school. Although tuition is free, there are many related costs. Hammock weaving is a lifeline for their family to reach a stable middle-class lifestyle. With her weaving income, she can earn as much as she would at a full-time job in the city, without losing her community (and the low cost of living in Huay Oi). Most important of all, weaving income is opening new opportunities for her children. 

This loan will not only give her the income security she needs but also a chance to move ahead even further with her earning potential.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials so she can secure consistent hammock work

loans.name: Dokor

texts.en:
Dokor was born and raised in Huay Oi  (“Sugar Cane Creek”) Village in rural Northern Thailand. She and her family live in a 200-year-old settlement near the original Yellow Leaf weaving village.  Unlike the first Yellow Leaf weavers, Dokor is not a member of a hill tribe- ethnically, she is Thai. However, life in their remote community has been marked by many of the same troubles that hill tribes have faced: marginalization, limited education and limited opportunity. 

Without other options available to her, Dokor spent most of her working years as a subsistence farmer alongside her husband, living from harvest to harvest. Her village traded salt, chili peppers and other food with the Mlabri Tribe, which is how she first learned about the growing opportunity brought by weaving hammocks.

Through practice and determination, Dokor has become one of the fastest and most talented weavers in the community. With her talent and improved income, she became a role model for her neighbors, who were inspired to become weavers by her example. Now Dokor is also a highly-sought weaving instructor. She volunteers to train new weavers, spreading the life-changing opportunity to other women in the community. 

Dokor is able to support her children’s education through secondary school—and even put her oldest daughter through university with money earned from weaving (a revolutionary step to assure her future!). This year she has taken a bold step in committing to full-time hammock weaving and training, leaving the fields behind for good. With job security and a loan she will be able to secure her family’s future and get even further ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials so she can secure consistent hammock work

loans.name: Javier Aldo

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 47 años,vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y su hijo, a quienes ama y so su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Javier no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
por iniciativa propia, Javier trabaja como albañil, el realiza construcciones, mejoramientos de viviendas y otras obras, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzos y dedicación en sus trabajos.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena y otros, ya que desea mejorar y reforzar su vivienda, de esta manera Javier desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Javier, 47, lives with his wife and son in the city of Ica. He loves them and they are his main motivation in life. He is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, fighting to get ahead with his family. Unfortunately, Javier could not study to become a professional because he had to work since he was young, due to the lack of economic resources.

Javier took the initiative to work as a mason. He works building and renovating houses and other types of buildings. He works every day for about ten hours and believes that he is doing well thanks to his hard work and dedication.

Javier is grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement and sand. He wants to make some home improvements and reinforce his house in order to make it safer for his family’s sake. This way, he will continue working hard in order to make his dream come true: to see his son becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is a seaweed farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and the mother of four children. Letecia has been engaged in seaweed farming with her husband for more than 10 years. Seaweed is valued as food and for industrial purposes. Letecia is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw. With this, she will be able to grow and improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and her income. In the future, Letecia dreams of making her business a successful and stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-milling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials and tools for the maintenance of her business. Lorna has been in this business for 25 years. Lorna earns additional income from farming rice. Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for the maintenance of her rice-milling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell in her shop, including rice, onions, cooking oil and sodas.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a married man with three children, two are going to school. He is living with his three children in order to provide for them.

Martin has been in the second-hand clothes business for the last eight years and he is proud of what he has harvested out of this business. For instance, he has been able to build a home, buy land, and take his children to school.

Alongside the clothes business, Martin extensively does agriculture with three acres of coffee trees that usually supplements the income that is generated from the clothes business. The main setting for Martin’s business is rural, however, he operates from the markets on a daily basis. Martin says his main clients are the common people from the markets where he operates and he faces challenges of high transport costs to markets and rainy seasons which hinder the accessibility to the markets.

Martin is very hopeful that the future will be bright with this loan he is acquiring. He hopes to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Isidro  ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo todo de si para poder salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como un medio de conocer como cada una está, donde 5  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
La  Sra. Carmen es manicurista y se siente muy bien con lo que hace, es una persona muy hábil, que sabe esculpir las uñas y hacer diseños, que es lo que más gusta a sus clientas. Gracias a que es muy buena haciendo su trabajo es reconocida en el barrio.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder mejorar sus insumos, ya que necesita esmaltes, acetonas, algodón pinceles y demás y de esa forma seguir trabajando y dando a sus clientes el buen servicio que siempre hace. Agradece por esta ayuda que recibe que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
The group called “San Isidro” is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are giving everything they have in order to get ahead. They have taken a poverty elimination survey so that each member becomes familiar with her own situation. Five members are below the poverty line.

Sra. Carmen is a manicurist and feels very good about what she does. She is a skillful individual who is knowledgeable about sculpting nails and making designs, which is what she enjoys doing most for her clients. Since she does very good work, Carmen is well-known in her neighborhood. Today she is requesting a loan so that she can improve her inventory of supplies. She needs nail polishes, acetone, cotton swabs, and other items so that she can continue working and providing good service to her clients like she always does. Carmen is grateful for the help she has received since it will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes, acetone, cotton swabs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Djibrilou

texts.fr: Monsieur Djibrilou est un homme marié et père de famille qui est âgé de 41ans. Il évolue dans le transport depuis 18ans. Il sollicite ce montant pour acheter un cheval qu'il va atteler avec une charrette pour subvenir aux besoins de transport de sa localité. Il gère la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Djibrilou commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. A l'avenir il souhaite terminer la construction de sa maison qui est en chantier
texts.en:
Djibrilou is a 41-year-old married man and father. He has been working in transportation for the past 18 years. He has requested a loan to buy a horse that he will hitch to a cart in order to meet the transportation needs of his community.

He manages the daily household expenses of his family and the school fees for his children. Djibrilou starts his work day at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. In the future he hopes to finish building his house, which is currently under construction.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for use in transportation.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.en: Safargul has run a sewing business since 2002. There are four people in her family, as she lives with her three children. Her husband died some years ago. She sews traditional dresses, and she also sews traditional pillow and mattress covers. She sews very beautiful dresses. Safargul is going to repair her house and improve her family’s living conditions. Her grandchildren are little, and that’s why she plans to provide good living conditions. This is her third loan from IMON, and she has a good credit history. She is an honest person. She is aplying for a loan of 1500 TJS (Tajik Somoni) to buy building materials, such as cement and wood. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and wood, to repair her house.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 46 años de edad y es madre y padre  para sus tres hijos de las cuales los tres todavía están a su lado. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la venta de comida y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ella vende platos de comida desde muy temprano en uno de los mercados de la ciudad en donde tiene un puesto de venta, ella vende comida los días lunes a sábado pero los días domingos lleva a vender carne  a la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 46 years old and is mother and father to 3 children, all of whom remain at her side. She belongs to the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana communal bank because she is a responsible and enterprising person. Her economic activities include selling meals and raising small farm animals, for example, guinea pigs and hens. 

Cecilia sells plates of food from very early on in one of the city markets where she has her sales post. She sell meals Monday through Saturday, but on Sunday, she sells meat in the city of Cusco.

On this occasion, she needs a loan to purchase hens.

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bags  of rice to sell. Cristy has been in this business for 10 years. Cristy earns additional income from motorcycle transport, from farming vegetables and from raising chickens. Cristy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for his business, including beer, soda, water and cooking oil.

loans.name: Oykiz

texts.en:
Oykiz is hard-working and honest person. She is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. 

Oykiz is a sewer. She sews national women's dresses. She decided to start a new business with sewing in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got enough skills about business.  She will manage the business alone. 

To organize a new business, Oykiz is asking for a loan of TJS 1,000 (somoni) to buy cattle. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to organize a new business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, laundry soap, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries in her general store. Marites has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, laundry soap, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like shampoo, laundry soap, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Boly

texts.fr: Madame Boly est une femme âgée de 38ans qui évolue dans l'élevage des poulets de chair depuis plus de un ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle participe à la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Boly sollicite ce montant pour acheter des poussins qu'elle élève pour les revendre à ses clients. Madame Boly commence sa journée à 8 pour la terminer à 18h. A l'avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une ferme agricole pour diversifier son activité et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Boly is a 38-year-old woman who has been raising broiler chickens for over a year. She is married and has a child. She participates in the management of her family's daily expenses. Boly has requested this loan in order to buy chicks that she will raise to sell to her customers.

Boly begins her work day at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. In the future she wants to open a farm to diversify her business and increase revenues in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise for resale as broiler chickens.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является ангелом доброты для своей семьи, хочет организовать свой бизнес. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Она живет вместе со своей семьёй в сельской местности и имеют маленький доход. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Ее старший сын имеет отдельное домохозяйство, а двое ее сыновья зарабатывают в Российской Федерации. Теперь Назокат планирует организовать свой бизнес. Она участвовала на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить скот. Скот она будет держать дома, где она имеет большой коровник. Она планирует купить скот, откармливать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This woman, who is an angel of kindness for her family, wants to organize her own business.  She is 47 years old, married and has five children.  She lives together with her family in a rural area and has a small income.  Her husband is involved in animal husbandry.  Her oldest son has a separate household, and her two other sons earn a living in the Russian Federation.  Now Nazokat plans to organize her own business.  She participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women.  She took part in this course and obtained a lot of positives for herself.  She obtained a certificate after completing the course.  Now she is ready to start the business, but does not have money to buy livestock.  She will keep livestock at home, where she has a large cowshed.  She plans to buy livestock, fatten it up for several months and resell it at a local market.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 US dollars to buy livestock.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to start her own business

loans.name: Hermes Nicolas

texts.es: Don Hermes es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Tiene 37 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo. De oficio comerciante, dueño de una venta de granos básicos. Su único apoyo ha sido su hijo, que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo lo ha apoyado en el negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: papel higienico, jabon, pasta dental, arroz, azúcar, frijol y cereal por quintal ya que comercializa sus productos al por mayor y al detalle. Sus metas próximas es aumentar su negocio, comprar un camión para facilitar expandir sus productos en diferentes departamentos y mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Hermes is a native of the city of Estelí.  He is thirty-seven years old, is married, and has one son.  He works as a businessman, and is the owner of a basic foods store.  His only source of support has been his son, who has helped the business through a lot of sacrifice and effort.  

He is requesting a loan to buy toilet paper, soap, toothpaste, rice, sugar, beans, and cereal by the quintal.  He already sells these products wholesale and at retail prices.  

His next goals are to grow his business, buy a truck (making it easier to get his products to different towns), and improve his quality of life, together with his family.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, soap, toothpaste, rice, sugar, beans, and cereal by the quintal.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, four of whom are in school, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Emma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат кредитуется первый цикл. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Рафоат родилась в сельской местности с детства помогала маме по животноводству и имеет достаточный опыт по данному направлению бизнеса. Рафоат участвовала на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат, и она хочет получить займ и начать свой бизнес животноводством. Рафоат имеет троих детей, 1 дочь и двоих сыновей. В прошлом году дочку выдала замуж.  По словам Рафоат сыновья будут помогать по купле-продаже скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать свой бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rafoat is obtaining a loan for the first time.  She is a conscientious and hardworking woman.  Rafoat was born in a rural area and has helped her mother with animal husbandry since childhood and thus has sufficient experience in this business field.  Rafoat participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  She wants to receive this loan and start her own animal husbandry business.  Rafoat has three children, one daughter and two sons.  She married off her daughter last year.  According to Rafoat's words, the sons will help with buying and selling livestock.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy livestock in order to start her business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to start her business

loans.name: Dushirehamwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Fabiola fait partie du groupe  Dushirehamwe II et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 34 ans et est mariée à Elie, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants agés de 1 à 10 ans dont 2 étudient.
Elle fait le commerce de farine    depuis 1 an. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de farine   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une  vache pour avoir de la bouse afin de fumer son  terrain de culture.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a member of the Dushirehamwe II Group, and lives in Gitega. She is 34 years old and is married to Elie, a merchant. Together they have three children between the ages of one and ten years old, two of whom are studying. She has been a flour merchant for the past year.

Fabiola is on her third loan with Turame. With the loan she receives from KIVA, she plans to increase her business capital and purchase a large quantity of flour that she will resell to earn more revenue. In the coming years, she would like to buy a cow so that she can use the dung to fertilize her field for crops.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of flour that she will resell to earn more revenue

loans.name: Digna Mae

texts.en:
Digna Mae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell for her business buying and selling rice grains. Digna Mae has been in this business for 5 years. Digna Mae earns additional income from farming rice. Digna Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is a 27-year-old young customer. He is married and the father of 2 kids. Fuad is IDP [an internally displaced person], and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as selling cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Fuad has more than 7 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. He receives 80 AZN financial supports from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover the family needs.

Fuad usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. This and the milk products are the only financial income in his family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Fuad applied for 1,800 AZN to purchase one calf, one milking cow, and fodder. He has a good client history and this is his 5th loan.

loans.use: to purchase one calf, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: Gulevse

texts.en:
Gulevse is 47 years old and not married . She is an IDP (internally displaced person ). Gulevse raises sheep and sells them for meat. She has been doing this business for 15 years and is a very hard-working person. She puts a lot of effort into this activity because she wants to support her old parents, without lacking financially herself.

Gulevse is keeping a flock of sheep in her own yard. She fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase this. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, and pilovs. 

She has taken loans and has a good loan history. This is going to be her third loan. This time, she requires AZN 1,800 to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer. She is optimistic about this loan because, in the summer, more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Дилафруз. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3  детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более10 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A kind person, who always tries to improve her living conditions and hopes for a brighter future, needs financial support.  Her name is Dilafruz.  She is 28 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Because she lives in a rural area, she has a good opportunity to develop her animal husbandry business.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over ten years and has a lot of experience in this business area.  Thanks to the good condition of her livestock, she has regular customers.  She wants to develop her business and earn more income.  She plans to use the resulting income to improve her living conditions.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase working capital

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Âgée de 38ans, madame Afi vit avec son conjoint et leur enfant de 07ans à l'école. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des céréales et des produits divers à Lomé. c'est depuis 2003 qu'elle a démarré cette activité et elle s'y plait bien car cela lui permet de se prendre en charge. N'arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère avec le profit, avoir une boutique car elle exerce l'activité à domicile et assurer l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Afi is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband and their seven-year-old child who attends school. To contribute to the needs of her family, she resells grains and various sundries in Lomé. She has been running this business since 2003 and she likes it very well because it allows her to support herself.

Since she is no longer able to meet her customers' needs, Afi is seeking her first loan from WAGES to purchase more merchandise. Afi hopes that with the revenue she earns, she will be able to open a shop instead of running her business from home. She also plans to ensure the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase grains and sundries for resale.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Luisa no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería.
por iniciativa propia, Luisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa,tanto para damas y caballeros, también vende comida, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Luisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara materiales de construcción para mejorar y reforzar su vivienda, de esta manera Luisa brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 58-year-old woman.  She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her four children.  She loves her children, and they are her main motive in life.  She is a very loving, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, and dedicates all of her efforts to getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the necessity for her to work from a very young age, Luisa could not study to become a nurse.

Through her own initiative, Luisa has a small business selling clothing for both women and men.  She also sells food.  She works every day for approximately ten hours, and believes that everything is going well because of the good prices and kind demeanor she offers to others. 

Luisa is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the offered support, she will be able to buy construction materials so that she can improve and strengthen her home.  In this way, she will be able to offer the best security and welfare to her family.

Luisa will continue working and applying herself so that she can achieve her greatest dream: to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
A hardworking woman named Barno lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who works as builder and has a very small salary. They have three clever children, ages 9, 4 and 3. Barno’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but her income from selling food items is not enough to repair it; she must repair all the rooms of her house. 

Barno is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to repair her house. 

This will enable her to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability, allowing them to progress. 

She will make her payment on time each month. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia is 63 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eutiquia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, bath soap, detergent soap, etc. 

In the future, Eutiquia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is 63 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Feliza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Feliza has been farming vegetables for five years, and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Felanie

texts.en:
Felanie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has had a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines for five years.

Felanie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Felanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño está en su ciclo 3° donde 6 de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que vienen haciendo, todas y cada una de ellas están con muchas esperanzas de ir mejorando y también poder capacitarse.
Ramona, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con bajos ingresos, es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene ventas de ropa usada y a la vez es limpiadora, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  venta prendas para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Divino Niño” (Divine Child) is in its third loan cycle. According to the latest poverty elimination survey that the members took, three of them have very low incomes. Each member has high hopes of improving and they will also receiving training.

Ramona is at a Level 1 poverty rating according to the last survey. In other words, she has low income. Ramona is aware that she must continue her effort and work in order to improve her family’s well-being. Her work involves selling used clothing and holding a job as a cleaner. It should also be noted that Ramona is working with advisers who are constantly monitoring her training and verifying her progress. This method gives the women an incentive to put forth the effort to overcome poverty.

Sra. Ramona is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothing to sell. This will help to solidify her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is 63 years old and married with eleven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Eutropia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Eutropia has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sirac

texts.en:
Sirac is a farmer with 17 years of experience. He is engaged in farming and animal husbandry. His family's only income is from the sale of dairy products and greens. Now he is 27 years old, married and father of two kids. 

Sirac is an internally displaced person (IDP), and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.

He buys animals (baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. He has a good approach towards business expansion and savings for the future. He makes enough through his business to contribute to the family income, but he needs to improve his business to meet the needs of his children.

For the improvement of his business, he applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN to purchase two more cows. He is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, he will definitely expand his business and income level. 

This is his fourth loan, and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.en:
Gulsanam is 58  years old, married and the mother of three beautiful children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gulsanam and her husband have their own business, earning income to meet their family's needs. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 13 years. During these years, she gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of her business. 

She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. She also makes homemade yogurt and sells it, along with fresh milk, to her neighbors. Her monthly income is about 144 AZN. This business is the family's only source of income. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau (a rice dish) and dolma (stuffed grape leaves).

Now Gulsanam  would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. She will buy three calves and one milk cow. This will be her fifth loan with AqroInvest, and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 46 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are in school. 

Gena is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gena has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 38 years old and married with six children.

Ma. Lorena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase  bath soap, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Lorena has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns  income from food vending.

Ma. Lorena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bath soap, canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gilinda

texts.en:
Gilinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials like nipa and bamboo for her buy and sell business.

Gilinda has been in this business for four years. Gilinda earns additional income from pig fattening.

Gilinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials like nipa and bamboo for her business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man, 46, with seven children. He lives on the outskirts of Kyotera town with his family. His children are 24, 22, 18, 16, 13, 10 and 2 years old; four are still at different levels of learning.

Godfrey is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically passion fruit and coffee growing. He works six days in a week and each day he works for eight hours. He is also a seasonal produce trader, where he earns some income to supplement his main business. He has been in the agriculture business for thirteen years, and he started it because he had experience.

This is his second loan cycle. For the first cycle, he acquired ugx.1,000,000.  Now he is looking for ugx.2,000,000 to buy organic manure and pesticides for passion fruit and coffee plantations. He sells his products to traders from the city.

His greatest dream is to grow passion fruit and coffee on a large scale. But he has challenges like unpredictable weather conditions, price fluctuations for these products, and insufficient capital.

He describes himself as hard-working man, and says Ugafode should continue giving services to the people.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fátima, con 51 años de edad, vive con su esposo y no tiene hijos. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la actividad de la confección, elaborando blusas, conjuntos deportivos y artículos para el hogar de su línea propia, esta actividad la aprendió de forma empírica y poco a poco fue perfeccionando sus productos, lo que le ha permitido ser reconocida en el sector donde reside y generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. La cliente es una mujer activa, apasionada por su labor y dedicada a su familia, por quien lucha incansablemente. 
Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (máquina recubridora), comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos) y para realizar mantenimiento a las máquinas, con esto podrá mejorar su producción, pues las máquinas funcionarán de forma correcta y tendrá más variedad de telas y colores para ofrecer a sus clientes, además podrá entregar un producto bien terminado y de muy buena calidad, lo que se verá reflejado en el aumento de sus ventas  y de sus ingresos. Fátima sueña con  hacer crecer su negocio, para poder brindar oportunidades de empleo y, además tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida, para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Fátima, age 51, lives with her husband and has no children. She has been a seamstress for 18 years, making blouses, sportswear, and household items from her own line. Fátima learned her trade through trial-and-error and gradually perfected her products. As a result, she has become well-known in the area where she lives and is able to generate income to help her husband with the financial burden of supporting their household. Fátima is an active woman who is passionate about her work, dedicated to her family, and tirelessly puts forth her best effort.

She is currently requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fixed assets (a cover stitch machine) and supplies in bulk (fabrics, thread, and elastics), as well as pay for the maintenance of her machines. This will help improve production since the machines will function in the correct manner. By having a wider variety of fabrics in different colors to offer to her customers, Fátima will also be able to deliver well-finished products that are of good quality. This is already reflected by the increase in her sales and her earnings.

Fátima dreams of growing her business and providing job opportunities. She will also be able to improve her living conditions and enjoy a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a cover stitch machine, fabrics, thread, elastics, and pay for the maintenance of her machines.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with seven children, all in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees.
She sells goats and also sells goats meat to market dwellers and passersby. Her greatest challenge is seasonality. She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase three goats for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase three goats for resale

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer se formo con la unión de varias amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando en sus respectivos emprendimientos.
Marina es una persona digna de destacar, quien se está esforzando por capacitarse y poder aprender. Ella se dedica a la costura y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela que día a día le hace pedidos y gracias a eso está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos y de esa forma poder seguir con su costura y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Renacer” (To Be Reborn) is a group of several friends and neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo. They are hardworking women who want to move forward and improve their respective businesses.

Marina is a decent individual who is worthy of notice. She puts forth the effort in her training and is willing to learn. Marina is a seamstress and has a very good clientele. She receives orders every day, which enables her to get ahead and help her family. Marina is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fabrics and thread. This will allow her to continue her work as a seamstress and to complete the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 34 years old and a mother of two sons. She lost her husband two months ago. Now she is the only person who can take care of her family. Kamala is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

As you can see from the photo, she has land but she does not have enough funds to cultivate the land or grow fruit trees or vegetables. For that she needs a loan 2,000 AZN to buy fruit trees, seeds and fertilizers. She has already taken two loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for a 4th loan.  

Kamala awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man, 36 years old, with five children. He lives in Kyotera town with his family. His children are ten, eight, six, four, and two years old, respectively. He also takes care of another five children whom he pays school fees for. He has ten children who are attending schools in rural settings.

Moses is a businessman who deals in charcoal trading and he supplements his income with a salary he got from teaching. His business works five days a week and each day it opens for 12 hours. He thanks Kiva lenders for partnering with him.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
A kind woman named Mahsuda has been busy with sewing native pillows and mattresses. She lives with her family in a house in poor condition. She is widowed. Her husband died some years ago. She has 3 clever children. One of them is an adult and two of them are non-adults. She is 51 years old. She has been busy with her business for more than 10 years. 

Mahsuda wants to raise her children with good living conditions. She has a plan to repair her house but she does not have the money to buy building materials. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy building materials, such as wood and cement, to repair her house. In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and the moral stability that will allow them to progress. 

She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials, like wood and cement, to repair her house.

loans.name: Princess D.

texts.en: Meet 24-year-old Princess D., who lives in a community surrounding Airport in Liberia. She is single with a 1-year-old child who lives at home. For the past five years, Princess D. been baking and selling bread in the local market. She started her business with money from her mother and learned how to sell from her.  She sells from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. from Monday to Saturday. Princess D. is grateful for her business because she earns money every day. She plans to build a house and expand her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter etc for her bread business. She would like to thank BRAC Liberia for continued support.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter etc for her bread business.

loans.name: Maria Virgen

texts.es:
María Virgen, es una joven que desea estudiar Negocio internacional, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Hola. Mi nombre es María, soy una estudiante de 18 años de edad y resido en Santo Domingo República Dominicana, País donde nací y humildemente he vivido durante toda mi vida en compañía de mi padre, mi madre y mis hermanos.
Ya he culminado mi bachillerato con mucho sacrificio y éxito cumpliendo así una de mis metas, ahora necesito de tu ayuda con el pago de mi matrícula para continuar realizándome como profesional en los estudios universitarios, al cursar la carrera “Negocios Internacionales” en UNAPEC, universidad Acción pro-educación y cultura ubicada en Santo domingo. Tu aporte me llevara a cumplir uno de mis más grandes sueños, ya que mi situación actual no me lo permite por el hecho de compartir los pocos recursos en una familia de 3 hermanos más. Sé que con tu apoyo podre obtener mi licenciatura graduándome satisfactoriamente para brindarle al estado un pequeño aporte en el ámbito laboral, apoyo económico a mi familia y sobre todo una retribución a KIVA y Fundapec por su gran ayuda para conmigo.
Ser ejemplo para mis familiares, para muchos jóvenes y más que nada continuar impulsándome a cumplir mis metas, son parte de mis ideales y necesito que me ayudes a llevarlos a la realidad.
texts.en:
María Virgen is a young woman who wants to study International Business.  She’s requesting a loan to be able to attend school.  This is her story:

Hello.  My name is María.  I’m an 18-year-old student living in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, the country of my birth and where I’ve humbly lived my entire life in the company of my father, my mother and my siblings.

I completed high school with much sacrifice and success thus reaching one of my goals.  Now I need your help to pay for my tuition so that I can continue developing as a professional with university studies majoring in International Business at UNAPEC, the Pro-Education and Culture Action University located in Santo Domingo.  Your contribution will make it possible for me to reach one of my greatest dreams because my current situation does not allow me to do so because my family’s scarce resources have to be shared by a family consisting of three additional siblings.  I know that with your support I will be able to get my Bachelor’s Degree graduating satisfactorily to make a small contribution to the state in the work environment and to support my family economically and above all to repay Kiva and Fundapec for the great help they’ve given me.

Some of my ideals that I need your help to reach are:  to set an example for my family and for many other young people and more than anything else to continue pushing myself to reach my goals.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is 36 years old, married, and has a daughter. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli in Azerbaijan, who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income, while his daughter goes to school. 

Azer started his taxi business two years ago. Now he needs a loan of 900 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to repair his car. In the future, he wants to buy a new car as this will be more profitable for his business. Azer is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena works hard to support her family. Serena is single and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Serena requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell on her fruit stall.

Serena has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Serena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell on her fruit stall.

loans.name: Hermilina

texts.en:
Hermilina is 46 years old and married with three children.

Hermilina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, bread, sugar, shampoo etc to sell.

Hermilina has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Hermilina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, bread, sugar and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Christo's 1 Group

texts.en:
The group Christo 1 consists of nine members, eight women and one man. They are originally from Accra-Dansoman, a place that is located in the eastern part of the country. These individuals are known as hardworking and responsible people who have the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their children. Unfortunately, due to the a lack of financial resources their vegetable, cassava, plantain, smoked fish, bed sheet and mineral businesses are not running as they expect.

Ernest is the representative of this group. He sells fanta, coca-cola and malt guinness. He operates a drinking spot in front of his home. Ernest works in his business approximately 17 hours each day offering his products. This is his first loan and the amount of GHS 500 will be invested as operating capital in his business of buying and selling fanta, coca-cola, malt guinness and sprite. In the not-so-distant future, he hopes to generate more income and more profit after taking many loan from ID-Ghana.

Christo 1 is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders will provide to them, so that they can have decent businesses. They need a total loan amount of GHS 3,700.

loans.use: to have operating capital for his business buying and selling fanta, coca-cola, malt guinness and sprite.

loans.name: Maria Del Mar

texts.es:
María Del Mar, es una joven que desea estudiar Publicidad, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es María del Mar, tengo 17 años y vivo en Santo Domingo, República Dominicana; lugar donde nací y crecí felizmente, junto con mi  papá que es ebanista, mi mamá que es empleada y hermano menor. 
He decidido que quiero estudiar en la universidad APEC en Santo Domingo, ya que es reconocida por su gran calidad en la carrera de mi elección, Publicidad. Quiero estudiar publicidad porque esta  carrera  me apasiona y sé que puedo explotar al 100% mis habilidades, es algo que me inspira y sé que puedo realizar con empeño dando lo mejor de mí a los demás y a la sociedad. Pienso comenzar a estudiar si Dios me lo permite en agosto de este mismo año.
En mi hogar apenas alcanza para el sostenimiento de la familia  por eso  necesitamos ayuda ya que no tenemos los recursos necesarios para pagar mis estudios y por eso hemos solicitado este préstamo, obtenerlo sería la oportunidad de estudiar y así crecer como persona y cumplir una de mis metas de ser profesional para así también ayudar a personas que necesiten como yo en este momento. 
Mis metas son trabajar ejerciendo mi carrera de manera que pueda sostenerme como un ser independiente, aportar a mi país,  ayudar a mi familia en cualquier necesidad,  hasta llegar conocer culturas diferentes y tener mi propia familia en el momento correcto de mi vida.
texts.en:
María Del Mar is a young woman who wants to study Publicity.  She’s requesting a loan to be able to carry out her studies.  This is her story:  

My name is María Del Mar.  I’m 17-years-old and I live in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, the place where I was born and where I happily grew up alongside my father who is a cabinetmaker, my mother who is employed and a younger brother.

I’ve decided that I want to attend APEC University in Santo Domingo which is renowned for the great quality of the career I’ve chosen: Publicity.  I want to study publicity because it’s a career I’m passionate about and the one I want to exploit my skills 100% in.  It’s something that inspires me and that I know I can do with effort giving my best to others and to society.  I plan to start my courses, God willing, in August of this very year.

At home it’s barely enough to support the family which is why we need help because we don’t have the resources needed to pay for my studies and this is why we are requesting this loan.  Getting it would mean the opportunity to study and grow as a person and reach one of my goals of becoming a professional to thus also help people in need like I am at the moment.

My goals are to work practicing my profession in such a way that I can support myself independently, to contribute to my country and to help my family with any need and to get to know different cultures and to have a family of my own at the proper time in my life.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Durdane

texts.en:
Durdane lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. She is 40 years old; she is a widow and has a child. It is hard for her to looking after a child alone. 

Durdane started a poultry business 3 years ago. Now she needs a loan of 2,100 AZN to buy geese. In the future she wants to use the profit to pay for home repairs. 

In the future, Durdane wants to have a big farm for poultry. This will be more profitable for her business. She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy geese

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and is a single mother of four children; she supports two who are in school.

She has a kiosk in Naivasha which she has operated for the past four years. She has applied for her third loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy a stock of bananas, breads etc. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open a shop for her son.

She hopes to expand her business so as to increase her income in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a stock of bananas and breads.

loans.name: Vilma Yanet

texts.es:
VILMA YANET
ELLA ES PROPIETARIA DE UNA MICROEMPRESA YA QUE SE DEDICA A ELABORAR UNIFORMES DISFRACES ETC…. Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA TIENE UNA  MISCELANEA(TIENDA DE CONSUMO DIARIO)  DENTRO DE LA COMUNIDAD ELLA ES MUY CONOCIDA POR LA FORMA DE TRABAJAR ELLA HA TRABAJADO DURANTE 3 AÑOS CONSECUTIVOS CON LA FUNDACION HA DEMOSTRADO SER UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y HONESTA EN ESTA OCACION MENCIONA QUE ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON KIVA POR EL APOYO Y LA CONFIANZA QUE LE HAN BRINDADO YA QUE APARTE DEL CREDITO QUE SE LE OTORGO ANTERIORMENTE ELLA PUDO CRECER TAMBIEN CON LA MISCELANEA(TIENDA DE CONSUMO DIARIO) LA CUAL LE SIRVIO PARA SURTIRLA CON EL CREDITO ANTERIOR PERO YA CANCELADO Y ELLA NUEVAMENTE HACE LA SOLICITUD DE UN NUEVO CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE OTRA MAQUINA DE COSER EN ESTA OCACION UNA MAQUINA QUE ELABORE MUCHOS TIPOS DE PUNTADAS ESPERANDO QUE SE LE TOME EN CUENTA DICHA SOLICITUD, YA KIVA LE A AYUDADO A SUPERARSE EN SU NEGOCIO TANTO COMO EN LA MICELANEA COMO EN LA COSTURERIA.
texts.en:
Vilma Yanet owns a micro firm; she works manufacturing uniforms, costumes, etc. and as a secondary activity she owns a variety store (basic staples store).  She’s very well-known in the community because of the way she works.  

She’s worked with the Fundación for three consecutive years and has shown herself to be a responsible, honest person.  On this occasion she mentions that she’s very grateful to Kiva for the support and trust they’ve given her because in addition to the loan she was granted previously she was also able to grow in the variety store (basic staples store) which she was able to stock with the previous loan.  

Now that she’s repaid it she once again is asking for a new loan to buy another sewing machine.  On this occasion it’s a machine able to do a variety of stitches.  She hopes her request will be taken under consideration because Kiva has helped both her sewing and her variety store businesses to improve

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es: José es un hombre de 29 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 2 años y es soltero. Actualmente es empleado de una empresa, pero para complementar sus ingresos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio y desde el año 2011 incursionó en la actividad agropecuaria, para lo cual obtuvo vacas lecheras, cuyo líquido es vendido a familiares, amigos y vecinos del pueblo donde reside; esta actividad la aprendió cuando acompañaba a un amigo a ordeñar vacas en una finca. Esto le ha permitido obtener más recursos para poder solventar las necesidades básicas. El cliente es emprendedor, activo, dinámico y siempre está en constante búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades de salir adelante, por lo cual encuentra en el crédito que solicita, un apoyo para avanzar. El dinero será invertido en la compra de ganado (vaca productora de leche) con lo cual podrá aumentar su producción y satisfacer toda la demanda del producto, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos. José sueña con independizarse totalmente para lo cual desea tener  su negocio agropecuario bien constituido, que sea rentable y le brinde una mejor solvencia económica, para mejorar las condiciones de vida y disfrutar al lado de su hijo de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a single man who is 29 years of age and the father of a two-year-old son. He is currently employed at a company, but in order to supplement his income, he decided to start his own business. In 2011, José got started in farming activities by acquiring dairy cows. The milk that is produced is sold to relatives, friends, and neighbors in the town where he resides. He learned this trade by accompanying a friend who milks cows on a farm. This business enables José to earn more income for covering basic necessities.

He is an enterprising, active, and dynamic client who is always looking for new opportunities to get ahead. For this reason, José is requesting support for advancing his business. The money will be invested in the purchase of cattle (a dairy cow) so that he can increase production and satisfy the demand for his product. As a result his earnings will improve.

José dreams of becoming totally independent and having a well-established farming business that is profitable and financially solvent. As a result, his living conditions will improve and he will be able to enjoy a better quality of life with his son.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina, a 59-year-old widowed mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 28 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Having borrowed and repaid two previous loans from NWTF, Rizalina is requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to purchase more soft drinks, canned goods, egg, noodles, etc. for her store.

Rizalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer, 2 liters of foliar fertilizer, 1 liter of insecticide, and the rest is for paying for labor.

loans.name: Tabu Mathew

texts.en:
Tabu used the previous loan to establish her business better by expanding it. She now has a variety of different flour that she sells to her customers. Her business has grown very much. 

She is now taking a loan worth 2,000 South Sudanese Pounds to buy more flour for her business. She says her business is growing well with the loans she receives and her family lifestyle has also improved.

loans.use: to buy flour to sell.

loans.name: Amahoro Group

texts.fr:
Chantal  fait partie du groupe  Amahoro et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 34 ans et  est mariée  à Hassan, un commerçant .Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 9 à 18 ans ,tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants orphelins.
 
Elle fait le commerce de  pagnes  depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son seizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  pagnes  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait ouvrir un petit magasin de pagnes.
texts.en:
Chantal is a part of the Amahoro group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is 34 years old and is married to Hassan, a trader. Together they have three children aged 9 to 18, all students. She has two orphaned children under her care.
 
Chantal has worked selling pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] for five years. She is on her 16th loan from Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy pagnes in order to resell and earn more. In the coming years, she would like to open a small cloth store.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy pagnes in order to resell and earn more

loans.name: Christo's 2 Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the representative of her group, the Christo 2 group and her group is located in Teshie, Ghana. She is a married mother of two children. Elizabeth also wants to establish her business by building a local shop on a plot of land next to her house.
